content: The Church of Scientology has been accused of covering up allegations of sexual assault against actor Danny Masterson. Several sources have claimed that the Church systematically protects its prominent members, including Masterson. A former member of the Church of Scientology has stated that the Church silences members who want to report alleged misconduct to law enforcement. The editor of "The Underground Bunker" has also claimed that Scientologists are not allowed to file lawsuits against other Scientologists or report them to authorities. Masterson has denied the allegations against him, and the Church of Scientology has denied being involved in stifling the claims of his accusers.

The world is blessed to have the beautiful family of Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez. The Portuguese soccer star's girlfriend recently shared an image of their newborn daughter, Alana Martina, smiling and giggling with joy. The Spanish beauty captioned the heartwarming picture with just one word: "Giggly."

This isn't the first time Rodriguez has shared a picture of her family. Just three days ago, she posted a photo of Ronaldo's 6-month-old twins, Eva Mar√≠a and Mateo, being held by the three wise men. She wrote, "In a few years, we'll write you all letters that will be kilometers long, but at this moment you scare us. Happy Three Kings Day!"

This family is a true blessing, and their love for each other is evident in every photo they share. They inspire us all to be happier and to find joy in the little things in life. We wish them all the gift of happiness this holiday season and a wonderful new year. Thank you for sharing your love with the world, Cristiano and Georgina.

Kris Jenner, a reality TV star, is said to be developing a new spin-off show called "Keeping Up with the Kids," which will focus on her grandchildren. The show will feature Kourtney Kardashian's children Mason, Penelope and Reign, Kim Kardashian's children North and Saint, and Rob Kardashian's unborn baby. However, Jenner's idea has reportedly sparked a "family war" as Kanye West, the husband of Kim Kardashian, is said to be against his children participating in the show. According to an insider, West was "ballistic" when he heard the idea and went to confront Jenner at her house. West is reportedly against exploiting his children and believes the show will not be in their best interests.

According to recent reports, Nina Dobrev and Glen Powell have been spotted spending time together, indicating a potential romantic relationship. This speculation was first reported in January and has since been confirmed by both parties. Dobrev and Powell have been seen at similar events and in similar social circles, and were even spotted together at the Coachella music festival in April, where Dobrev was rumored to be dating Orlando Bloom. However, it was later revealed that this was just a temporary relationship.

Dobrev and Powell are said to be close friends with Julianne Hough, who recently got married. They were seen at Hough's wedding and are also said to be well-matched professionally, as they are the same age and have reached similar levels in their respective careers.

Glen Powell has recently been seen on the set of the film "Set It Up" with Zoey Deutch, and Nina Dobrev has been spotted with her dog, Maverick, on the set of a film last month.

It is worth noting that the dog in these photos with Glen Powell appears to be Nina Dobrev's dog, Maverick.

Chris Brown has been romantically linked with both Rihanna and Karrueche Tran, but he has reportedly chosen Karrueche as his current partner. A source close to Chris Brown said that Karrueche truly "understands him" and that things are "easy and breezy" between them. Chris Brown has also been vocal about his feelings for Karrueche on Twitter, and a source said that she has been a bedrock of support for him during difficult times. However, Chris Brown and Rihanna have a complicated history and it may be difficult for them to reconcile despite their apparent infatuation.

Katy Perry shocked her fans with a tearful and intimate therapy session on Friday night, where she revealed everything from her struggles with her identity to the real reason behind her drastic haircut change. The 32-year-old pop superstar was livestreaming her entire life on her personal YouTube channel as part of the release of her new "purposeful pop" album, Witness. During the session, she sat down with Dr. Siri Sat Nam Singh, host of Viceland's The Therapist, to discuss her desire to live a more authentic life.

Perry admitted that she often feels divided between her pop persona, Katy Perry, and the real person her family and friends know, Katheryn Hudson, a "dork." This was part of the reason she decided to cut her hair into a short, nerdy pixie style. "I didn't want to look like Katy Perry anymore," she said. "I'm a bit more nerdy than everybody thinks I am, I'm a big goofball."

Perry also opened up about her past struggles with alcohol and her past battles with depression. She admitted that she had struggled with thoughts of suicide in the past and wrote a song about it. "I feel ashamed that I would have those thoughts, feel that low and that depressed," she said. "You can be right or you can be loved. I just want to be loved."

During the session, Perry was seen crying and mascara running down her face as she opened up about her past struggles. Dr. Singh described the session as "captivating and emotional" and said that he was surprised by how open and vulnerable Perry was. "The whole session was about the dichotomy of the conflict between her professional persona of Katy Perry and her individual human life of Katherine Hudson," he said. "At the end, she said that she was going to integrate them."

After the session, Perry was seen leaving with a wooden bowl filled with a fresh stack of Angel Cards, which appeared to give her exactly what she was looking for: "Freedom." Her 72-hour "Witness World Wide" YouTube special is running through Monday and culminates in a free concert for a select group of fans. Witness is out now and available to stream and purchase.

Suri Cruise has reportedly begged her father Tom Cruise to visit her, according to a source close to the situation. The source exclusively revealed that the 12-year-old actress has been contacting her father through a series of heartbreaking letters, calls, and voicemails. Although Tom's ex-wife, actress Katie Holmes, has denied this, the source claims that Suri has begged Tom to visit her and he has finally responded.

Kim Kardashian has been posting a series of nude photos on her Instagram account as part of a flirtatious game with her husband Kanye West. The 37-year-old celebrity believes that posting these photos is a way for her and Kanye to keep things spicy while he is away. Kim also enjoys sending private photos to Kanye and asking for his opinion on which photos should be shared publicly. Despite criticism from some, Kim is unapologetic about her decision to post these photos, stating that she is giving her fans what they want and that she knows that sex sells.

On a fateful day, the beloved cast of Sabrina the Teenage Witch gathered together for a reunion that brought tears to their eyes. The event, documented by Melissa Joan Hart, the star of the show, was a first for many of the actors, who had never met before.

As they took the stage together for the first time in 20 years, the crowd erupted in applause, a testament to the enduring love and connection between the actors and their characters. For the actors, it was a moment of pure joy and happiness that they would never forget.

Despite the CW's upcoming reimagining of the series, the cast confirmed that they had nothing to do with it and offered their own insights into what their characters would be up to in the modern world. Hart imagined that Sabrina and Harvey would be starting their own witch school and fostering children who were part mortal and part witch. Meanwhile, Broderick's Aunt Zelda would be driving an Uber in the other realm, while Rhea envisioned a more pathetic future for her character, Aunt Hilda.

For Alimi Ballard, who played The Quizmaster, the reunion was a chance to relive one of the greatest TV shows of all time. "Reunited. And it feels so good," he wrote on Instagram.

As the day came to a close, the cast members hugged and exchanged congratulations, a reminder of the special bond that they shared with their characters and with their fans. The memories they created that day would stay with them forever, a testament to the enduring power of love and friendship.

In August, Netflix will unleash a torrent of emotions upon its viewers with a new batch of movies and television shows. From the laughter-inducing dark high school comedy Insatiable to the heartwarming animated series Disenchantment from the mind of The Simpsons creator Matt Groening, there's something for everyone.

But that's not all. Netflix is also bringing some much-awaited films to its streaming service. Kristen Bell and Kelsey Grammer star in the heartwarming Like Father, out August 3, and Lily James plays a journalist in the World War II-set The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society, coming August 10. And if you've been missing the Jason Bateman drama series Ozark, its sophomore season will return on August 31.

Not to be outdone, Netflix is also adding a host of classic films to its collection, including Batman Begins, Clerks, Million Dollar Baby, No Reservations, Steel Magnolias, The Aviator, The Informant, Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, Princess Diaries 2, and No Country for Old Men.

So, if you're feeling down, lonely, or just looking for a good cry, Netflix has got you covered. Just remember to keep the tissues handy.

A source exclusively tells In Touch that Neil Patrick Harris made an unusual proposition to a friend while dining at Chicago's Girl & the Goat restaurant. The source claims that Neil approached the friend and asked for their number and invited them to his hotel later. The source also claims that Neil and his husband David Burtka are facing a relationship crisis. An insider close to the actor and the chef says that they love each other but want their relationship to be more harmonious. The insider notes that Neil is outgoing and loves to party, while David is a "Mr. Homebody" and finds Neil's high maintenance and moodiness draining. The source also notes that Neil and David have been dealing with their problems for a long time and have sought professional help through couples therapy. However, the therapy has not been consistent lately due to Neil's schedule, and tension has increased due to David's decision to stop drinking alcohol. The source adds that neither Neil nor David is willing to take the step of divorce lightly, as they both take their public marriage and kids as a serious responsibility.

In June 2017, Rihanna and Hassan Jameel were photographed making out in a pool at a private villa in Spain. At first, fans believed Jameel was a Spanish footballer, but he was actually a Saudi billionaire and the deputy president and vice chairman of Abdul Latif Jameel, one of the largest companies in the world. Rihanna was in an on-and-off relationship with Chris Brown, and it appears that Jameel is worried that Brown may try to win her back. Despite opening up to Jameel about her past, Rihanna is still focused on her career and has not yet met Jameel's family.

This week's Fake Story Award features two celebrities and their respective controversies. In the red corner, we have Angelina Jolie, who is reported to be on a secret hunger strike to draw attention to the plight of Syrian refugees. The National Enquirer claims that Jolie has been on a personally motivated hunger strike since her late teens. The Enquirer also reports on Jolie's "shroud" that she wore when going out to dinner, which they claim will come in handy when she finally loses her "brave battle."

In the blue corner, we have Tom Cruise, who is said to be leaving pooh all over his trailer on the set of the movie he is currently filming. US Weekly reports that Cruise engages in a bizarre anti-aging treatment that involves him having his stool samples analyzed by doctors, and keeping his shit in tupperware containers that he stores in his winnebago.

The winner of this week's Fake Story Award is up to you to decide. Vote in our poll below.

As the anticipation builds for the announcement of the cast for season 24, here is an updated list of rumors, divided into categories for easy reference.

Legitimate Possibilities:

* Normani Kordei
* Simone Biles
* Mr. T
* Chris Kattan
* Erika Jayne
* Nancy Kerrigan
* Nick Viall
* Heather Morris
* Charo
* Bonner Bolton

Longshots:

* Someone from Property Brothers/Jonathan Scott
* Someone from Storage Wars/Barry Weiss

The Definite No's:

Note that this list is not exhaustive and is subject to change. Any updates will be communicated as soon as they become available.

Joaquin "Jack" Garcia was a highly successful and prolific FBI Special Agent who used his physical size and numerous identities to infiltrate various crime families and corrupt circles. Over the course of more than two years, he posed as "Jack Falcone" to investigate the Gambino crime family in New York City, resulting in the conviction of 32 gangsters, including several family members. At the same time, he conducted a three-year sting operation in Florida that led to the arrest of four corrupt police officers.

During this same period, Garcia also participated in two separate undercover operations in Atlantic City, targeting corrupt politicians, and a Boston sting operation targeting corrupt police officers. A veteran law enforcement official who worked with Garcia described him as "the best undercover agent the Bureau has ever had."

Garcia also posed as a drug dealer and a jewel thief, and his performance was so convincing that members of the Gambino crime family took him in and made him a top member of their administration. He released an autobiography in 2008, which was later adapted into a film, but as of April 2017, the release of the film had not been announced.

Gwen Stefani's Las Vegas residency began in late June, but ticket sales for her "Just A Girl" show have been less than satisfactory. Despite performing at the Zappos Theater at Planet Hollywood, which has a capacity of 4,600 seats, there are still over 1,200 seats available for her next show, scheduled for this week, leaving 26% of the seats unaccounted for.

An insider has reported that tickets are not selling, with thousands of seats remaining unsold this month. Radar Online is reporting that all four remaining July dates have at least 1,100 empty seats, leaving Stefani "devastated." Sales for the December 27th to 31st shows are also unimpressive, with over 1,300 seats available for the December 30th concert, which is her worst night of sales.

Discount sites such as GoodSeatTickets.com have slashed prices by up to 75% due to the high number of available seats. However, sources suggest that Stefani has the option to return to "The Voice" if the show proves to be unsuccessful.

Stefani's boyfriend, Blake Shelton, has been vocal in his support of her Las Vegas residency, even joking on Twitter about his perfect attendance record to her shows. He has attended all three shows so far and has received a standing ovation from the crowd on the opening night of her show.

Stefani's "Just A Girl" show features her biggest hits, as well as her time with No Doubt and her romance with Shelton. While singing a song she says is about Shelton, she wears a cowgirl outfit. On the first night of the residency, Stefani told the crowd that it was a fantasy come true to wear a cowgirl costume in front of Shelton.

Ben Higgins, a former Bachelor contestant, has clarified recent rumors that he and his fiancee, Lauren Bushnell, have called it quits. He shared an Instagram post on Wednesday, featuring a photograph taken shortly before their engagement in Jamaica, in which Lauren is seen blissfully closed-eyed in Ben's embrace. While Higgins did not address the rumors directly, he reassured his 1.5 million followers that his feelings for Bushnell have not changed. "We have entered into a world where rumors will exist, we know that," he wrote. "But just know as @laurenbushnell celebrates her birthday tomorrow, I am still extremely lucky to be able to share life with her and be by her side." As of Thursday morning, Bushnell had not responded to rumors of a break-up, and was instead posting envy-inducing photos from a trip to the Four Seasons Resort Punta Mita in Mexico. The couple had a tumultuous journey during season one of their reality show, Ben & Lauren: Happily Ever After, with Higgins initially calling off their televised wedding before later announcing that it was back on in the show's season finale. Despite this, the couple remains in the running to be considered a success story on the Bachelor.

KAYA SCODELARIO, the star of hit TV show Skins, has revealed she suffered sexual assault at just 12 years old.

The stunning revelation came as the actress bravely joined the #MeToo movement, sharing her own harrowing story of abuse with the world.

In a tweet that sent shockwaves, Scodelario wrote: "It's taken me 13 years to say #MeToo. He is still protected by 'family members' in Brazil. They've told lies to papers to try to silence me. To finally speak out and not be afraid. To everyone still suffering silently, you never asked for it. NOBODY DOES. I do this for my son. So that he will see one day that we all have a voice. And that this behavior can not be tolerated any longer."

The actress, who plays Effy Stonem in the show, revealed that she kept her assault a secret for a decade, only sharing her story with her son.

But in a recent interview with Metro.Co.UK, Scodelario revealed that the response to her bravery had been overwhelmingly positive.

She said: "The response was wonderful. I am now dealing with a new side of it, which is this. I will be asked about it forever now. I hope it doesn't define me but it will always be under my name and I accept that ‚Äì but I am proud I was brave enough to do it and I am grateful for the support I had from friends."

Scodelario also revealed that her 12-year-old self was the driving force behind her decision to speak out.

She said: "I remember thinking that if I was 12-years-old and I had this horrific thing happen to me but I saw a woman I admired speaking up about it, it would have made me feel less guilty, and it would have inspired me to think 'this won't hold me back, this is something that has happened but I am not a victim.' So I thought if I can do that for one person then I owe it to my 12-year-old self."

Scodelario joins a growing list of women who have bravely come forward with their own stories of abuse, as the #MeToo movement continues to sweep across the world.

Actress Michelle Williams brought #MeToo founder Tarana Burke to the Golden Globes and opened up about navigating the uncertain times to help create a better world for the next generation, including her own 12-year-old daughter, Matilda Rose Ledger.

"I thought I would have to raise my daughter to learn how to protect herself in a dangerous world, but I think the work that Tarana has done and the work that I'm learning how to do ‚Äî we actually have the opportunity to hand our children a different world," Williams said on the E! red carpet pre-show. "I am honored beyond measure to be standing next to this woman. I have tears in my eyes and smile on my face."

To donate to the Time's Up Legal Defense Fund, which will provide subsidized legal support to women and men in all industries who have experienced sexual harassment, assault, or abuse in the workplace, visit its GoFundMe page. Learn more about Time's Up, an organization of women in entertainment combating sexual harassment and inequality, on its website.

Burke echoed Williams's sentiment and talked about the beginnings of the #MeToo movement, which spread all over social media as women spoke out against the sexual harassment they face in everyday life.

"This is something I started out of necessary and something my community needed, and it's grown this year and I couldn't have imagined it growing like this," Burke said. "But this moment is so powerful because there is collaboration between these two worlds that people don't put together. It's really powerful to be on the red carpet tonight and people like Michelle to give up her time to talk about our causes."

The 2017 Academy Awards ceremony has concluded, with Moonlight winning the Best Picture award. Despite initially being announced as the winner by presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway, La La Land was later revealed to have actually lost the award. La La Land went on to win six Oscars, including one for Emma Stone. Other winners included Casey Affleck, Viola Davis, and Mahershala Ali, who all took home acting awards. The full list of winners can be found below.

Gwen Stefani and Blake Shelton have been together for over two years and are reportedly happier than ever. A source close to the 41-year-old country singer told Entertainment Tonight that the couple is in a great place and that Stefani loves Shelton for who he is, including his style and manly qualities.

The couple was recently seen walking along the beach in Playa del Carmen, Mexico, where they were even spotted running into Shelton's friend Luke Bryan. Stefani was wearing a white bikini top and a black sarong, while Shelton was wearing a blue trucker hat and board shorts.

While they may have been an unexpected couple at first, Shelton and Stefani have been going strong for some time now. The source noted that the couple often visits Shelton's house in Oklahoma, where they spend time with Stefani's three sons from her previous marriage to Gavin Rossdale. Shelton acts as a father figure to the children and enjoys introducing them to country life.

The source also revealed that Shelton is devoted to Stefani and feels that everything in life happens for a reason. Although he was previously married to Miranda Lambert, he is now happy with the family he has with Stefani. The couple has not ruled out the possibility of starting a family together, but is happy with the family they have now.

In an interview with Entertainment Tonight in October, Shelton gushed over his girlfriend and her whole family, saying that it has been fun for him to introduce them to country life. He also noted that they have a lot of fun together and that it is probably not legal to have that much fun in California.

On Tuesday, September 20, Us Weekly reported that Angelina Jolie had filed for divorce from Brad Pitt, ending their 12-year relationship and two years of marriage. While some social media users are sad to see the end of one of Hollywood's most famous love stories, many are also recalling the complicated beginning of their relationship.

In 2004, Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston met on the set of Mr. and Mrs. Smith. At the time, Pitt was married to Jennifer Aniston. After Jennifer Aniston discovered that Brad Pitt was cheating on her with his costar, Angelina Jolie, she ended her five-year marriage. Months later, Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie went public with their relationship.

During an interview with Vogue in 2008, Jennifer Aniston addressed the scandal. "That stuff about how she couldn't wait to get to work every day? That was really uncool," she said.

Now that the Brangelina saga is over, social media is having a field day with Jennifer Aniston's revenge. Us has rounded up the best online reactions.

According to TMZ, Angelina Jolie filed for divorce from Brad Pitt on Monday, September 19, citing irreconcilable differences. She is reportedly requesting physical custody of their six children and joint legal custody. She is not asking for spousal support.

Angelina Jolie's representative issued a statement to Us regarding her decision to end her marriage to Brad Pitt. "Angelina Jolie Pitt has filed for dissolution of the marriage," the statement read. "This decision was made for the health of the family. She will not be commenting at this time, and asks that the family be given their privacy during this difficult time."

A source told Us that the couple often fought over how they parented their children. "Angelina did try to make it work, but her kids come first and she couldn't let them see Mommy and Daddy like this," the source said. "The fighting got worse and they disagreed a lot about parenting and a lot of things."

Pippa Middleton is reportedly concerned that inviting Meghan Markle to her upcoming wedding could divert attention away from her own wedding and onto Markle. Sources have indicated that Middleton has observed how much media attention Markle received at Prince Harry's friend's wedding in Jamaica and is worried that a similar situation could occur at her own wedding. Middleton and her mother Carole have reportedly implemented a "no ring, no guest" policy to limit the number of guests attending her wedding, which could potentially exclude Markle. However, it is uncertain whether Harry will adhere to this policy or if he will bring Markle to his sister-in-law's wedding regardless.

Kylie Jenner, 20, has been rumored to be engaged to Travis Scott, but recent reports suggest she is not ready for marriage. According to Hollywood Life, Scott asked Jenner to marry him during a trip to Miami, but she declined. A source close to Jenner explained that she wants to slow down the relationship and enjoy the current stage. Jenner's sister, Khloe Kardashian, has reportedly been giving her guidance to wait on the wedding. It appears that Jenner and Scott may not be rushing into marriage.

Miley Cyrus made headlines recently when she discussed her thoughts on hip-hop in an interview with Billboard. The singer named-checked Kendrick Lamar's "Humble" as an inspirational track and criticized other rap music for being too materialistic and misogynistic. Cyrus later clarified that her comments were made in the context of a broader conversation and that she respects all genres of music. She has collaborated with many hip-hop artists in the past and is now focusing more on uplifting, conscious rap.

Justin Bieber has been romantically linked with Hailee Steinfeld, according to reports from TMZ. The gossip site claims that the couple have been dating for over a month, following an introduction by Hillsong pastor Carl Lentz, who is a mutual friend of the singers.

Bieber, 23, and Steinfeld, 20, reportedly met at the Golden Globes in 2011, where Steinfeld was nominated for an Oscar for her role in True Grit. However, sources tell The New York Post that the actress is not interested in a romantic relationship with Bieber and has made it clear to him that she is only interested in a friendship.

Similarly, another source tells Us Weekly that the relationship between the two is not romantic and that Steinfeld is still dating Cameron Smoller, who she has been with since December. The couple first went public with their relationship in December, when Steinfeld shared an Instagram photo of herself cosying up to Smoller in front of the sunset.

Bieber has been romantically linked with several other women since his breakup with Selena Gomez in 2014, including Sofia Richie, Kourtney Kardashian, and model Hailey Baldwin.

On Wednesday, attorney L. Lin Wood, who is representing Vernon Unsworth, a diver criticized by Elon Musk as a "pedo guy," announced that he is preparing to file a libel lawsuit against the Tesla CEO. In a letter dated August 6, Wood accused Musk of making false and damaging statements against Unsworth, which were made at a time when Unsworth was working to save the lives of twelve Thai children trapped in a cave. The letter stated that Musk's tweets, which criticized Unsworth as a "PR stunt" and a "pedo guy," were made without any basis. Musk had previously apologized for his comments, which he said were made in anger. TheWrap has requested a comment from a representative of Musk.

Canadian singer Drake was filming a promotional video at the Houdini Estate in Laurel Canyon, Los Angeles, when he reportedly became frightened and fled the location. The estate, located in a area with a reputation for being haunted, has been visited by celebrities and rock stars over the years, but Drake's reaction has sparked debate. Some believe the story is true, while others question the credibility of the source and whether Gossip Cop may have created the story to debunk it.

Meet Laura Adkins, a 25-year-old woman who has married a cardboard cutout of Edward Cullen, the fictional character from the Twilight series. While some may view this as crazy, Laura considers it the closest she will get to the real thing and considers her "flat-pack R-Patz" to be the one for her. She married her cardboard husband in a Las Vegas chapel in January in front of 50 guests, and the cost of the wedding was $2,000.

After the wedding, Laura and her cardboard husband headed off on a honeymoon to Los Angeles, where Laura wanted to climb up to the Hollywood sign. Laura regularly takes her cardboard husband out to bars and orders him a beer while she drinks a gin and tonic. However, there are questions about the sustainability and identity of the cardboard cutout, as well as the practicalities of having a cardboard husband.

While some may view Laura's decision to marry a cardboard cutout as unconventional, others may see it as a way to fulfill a fantasy or express creativity. Ultimately, it is up to Laura to decide what makes her happy.

Jennifer Lopez and Mariah Carey have been the subject of rumors regarding a feud for several years. Although these rumors have been repeatedly denied by both parties, the topic continues to generate buzz.

In the early 2000s, Mariah Carey was interviewed by a foreign TV station and was asked about several pop stars. When asked about Jennifer Lopez, she responded by saying, "I don't know her." This statement led to a meme and a feud that has been widely debated.

Andy Cohen was the first to directly ask Jennifer Lopez about the feud in 2014. Lopez explained that she had read things that Mariah Carey had said about her in the past, but they had never actually met. Lopez stated that she was not aware of any past incidents and believed that the feud was largely the result of word of mouth.

Last year, Mariah Carey was interviewed by The Cut and discussed gifts she received from her fans. She mentioned a fan-made shirt with a quote that she had made years ago, which was taken out of context and blown out of proportion.

The feud was reignited after Lopez was caught checking Instagram during Carey's performance at the Billboard Music Awards. Lopez responded to this incident by saying that she had watched most of Carey's performance and was only briefly distracted.

Lopez has recently been promoting her numerous projects, including Shades of Blue and American Idol. During a visit to Watch What Happens Live, she addressed the feud again, stating that it was not fair to criticize her for looking down for one second during Carey's performance.

Lopez also appeared on The Wendy Williams Show where she was asked about Mariah Carey. When Williams joked about Carey's statement that she did not know Lopez, Lopez responded by saying, "She does say that. She's forgetful I guess."

Sources have reported that Angelina Jolie has recently moved into a six-bedroom home with her six children, Maddox, Shiloh, Zahara, Pax, Vivienne and Knox, in order to spend more time with their father, Brad Pitt, who lives just a mile away. An insider stated that the children are "much happier" to be living closer to their dad, and are back in the neighborhood they consider home, which is about a mile from Brad's house.

Jolie had been staying with her children in Malibu, which was about an hour drive from Brad, but they did not like being so far from their father. The actress had announced that she and Brad were divorcing in September 2016, citing "for the health of the family" as the reason for the decision.

Jolie's new home is a six-bedroom mansion that spans 11,000 square feet and includes an outdoor swimming pool with a pool house, a home gym and library, as well as huge landscaped gardens. The actress has been keeping a low profile since announcing her divorce from Brad.

Jennifer Aniston has separated from her husband Justin Theroux, but is reportedly not ruling out the possibility of dating again.

According to sources, the 49-year-old actress is in a good place and is enjoying being single. She is more interested in her work and living life than in a relationship at the moment.

It was reported that Justin has started dating artist Petra Collins, but it is unclear whether this is true. Aniston and Theroux released a joint statement in February announcing their separation, which they described as mutual and lovingly made.

Neither Aniston nor Theroux have spoken publicly about their split since then.

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge participated in Trooping the Colour, an annual event held on the Queen's birthday. For this year's festivities, the royal couple brought their children, Prince George and Princess Charlotte, to the event, marking their first appearance on the balcony. While the children's behavior was charming, with Prince George showing some grumpiness, the Queen appeared to be less than pleased. At one point, the Queen scolded William for kneeling down to George's level and reminding him of his royal protocol. The incident generated a lot of attention on social media, with some users expressing their love for George's facial expression. However, it should be noted that while the Queen is known to be a firm believer in royal protocol, she is also the only person who William appears to obey without question.

A man is facing charges for the murder of another person. He has claimed that he was acting in self-defense and that he had a justified cause for his actions. Emergency medical personnel have been called to the scene to treat the man's injuries. The man has been listening to music, including "Brown Sugar" by D'Angelo, and has been making threats. He has also been referring to himself as a "pumping" and "flyer" person. The man has also made references to religion and violence, stating that "vengeance is mine" according to the Bible and that he is "from the murder capital" where people are known to murder for capital offenses.

Selena and Justin's love story has been a rollercoaster of emotions, but it seems they have found a moment of peace. The two were spotted jetting off to Seattle for a romantic getaway over the weekend, leaving behind the chaos of their complicated past.

Meghan Markle's beloved dog, Guy, has been by her side through some of the most difficult times in her life, and now the bond between them has taken a new level. Before Meghan adopted him in 2015, he was on the verge of being put down by a shelter in Kentucky. But thanks to Dolores Doherty and her rescue charity A Dog's Dream Rescue, Guy was given a second chance. Doherty brought him to an adoption event just outside Toronto, where Meghan was living while filming Suits. Little did they know, Meghan was one of the hopeful dog owners.

Guy's journey didn't end there. After traveling 500 miles to the border, Doherty brought him to an adoption event, where Meghan finally adopted him. Meghan's other dog, Bogart, couldn't make the trip across the pond due to his age, but Guy has now moved to London with Meghan, a Kensington Palace rep confirmed in November.

Meghan's love of dogs is something she shares with her grandmother-in-law, Queen Elizabeth II, who is known to be very fond of corgis. Just last month, the Queen's last corgi, Willow, passed away at the age of 14. Perhaps hanging out with her new four-legged friend, Guy, has helped fill that hole.

Meghan and Guy's bond is obvious, and it's clear that they have a special connection. When Meghan first met the Queen's dogs, they laid happily at her feet during tea. Harry, Meghan's fianc√©, recalled in their first interview together, "For 33 years, I‚Äôve been barked at, and this one walks in, and absolutely nothing, just wagging tails."

Tomorrow, Guy will be by Meghan's side again as they walk down the aisle in one of the most important moments of their lives. Here's to hoping that they'll carpool to the wedding together, and that their love for each other will continue to grow.

When Thor: Ragnarok hits the big screens this weekend, it will mark a monumental moment in movie history. For the very first time, a Marvel Cinematic Universe movie will feature an openly bisexual character. Tessa Thompson's character, Valkyrie, has been confirmed to be bisexual by none other than Thompson herself.

"She's bi. And yes, she cares very little about what men think of her. What a joy to play!" Thompson tweeted in response to a fan thread where one user was complaining that Valkyrie has been turned into a "typical sexless marvel tomboy" compared to her comicbook counterpart.

Thompson stars alongside Chris Hemsworth as Thor and Mark Ruffalo as The Hulk in the highly anticipated intergalactic adventure. Cate Blanchett and Jeff Goldblum also star in the film, which will be released in cinemas on 24 October in the UK and 3 November in the US.

The inclusion of Valkyrie in the MCU is a significant step forward for the LGBTQ+ community in Hollywood. It sends a powerful message that representation matters and that everyone deserves to be seen and heard.

Valkyrie's character arc in the film has been closely watched by fans of the comicbooks. Thompson's portrayal of her is sure to be just as fierce and empowering as fans have come to expect from the character.

This is a momentous occasion for the LGBTQ+ community in Hollywood and a reminder that representation matters. Valkyrie's inclusion in the MCU is a victory for everyone who has ever wanted to see themselves reflected on the big screen. We can't wait to see what she brings to the table in Thor: Ragnarok.

Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes have been in the public eye for over a decade, since Cruise publicly declared his love for Holmes on The Oprah Winfrey Show. "There are more important things," Holmes continued. "But it's very relatable to me; if people know who you are, they might write about you, and you can't control that."

Throughout the interview, Holmes remained coy about how private she keeps Suri's life, but was direct about her main focus: maintaining Suri's childlike innocence as long as possible.

"My child is the most important person to me, and her upbringing is paramount to my work right now," Holmes said. "It's very important that I'm present and she has a stable, innocent childhood. I feel so blessed to do what I do, but there's nothing in the world better than watching your child succeed."

As the controversy surrounding Sacha Baron Cohen and his new show, Who Is America?, continues to swirl, Showtime has finally issued a statement in support of their star. The statement debunks the widespread misinformation and false allegations that have been circulating, revealing the truth about Cohen's character Billy Wayne Ruddick Jr., PhD.

The statement begins by addressing the misconceptions about the character's background, stating that Cohen did not present himself as a disabled veteran or a U.S. military veteran to Sarah Palin or during the filming of her interview. In fact, Cohen did not even wear military apparel during these interactions.

The statement further emphasizes that Cohen's character did not mock or deceive Palin during their interview, as she claimed. Instead, Cohen's character simply stated that he was not disabled and used a mobility scooter to conserve his energy.

Despite Palin's heated reactions to Cohen's character and the show's premise, Showtime remains firmly behind their star. The network believes that Cohen's comedic talents and ability to shed light on important social issues through his unique and unconventional approach are what make the show so compelling and valuable.

While it remains to be seen whether the show will be a ratings hit, the controversy surrounding it has certainly generated plenty of buzz, and Palin's negative reactions to Cohen's character have only added to the conversation.

The beloved British television series, Downton Abbey, is coming back - but this time, it's not on the small screen. Focus Features announced on Friday that it has set an official production timeline for a cinematic continuation of the show, with key members of the original cast returning for the project.

Though an official cast list has yet to be revealed, Entertainment Weekly has learned that Michelle Dockery, Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, and Joanne Froggatt - all of whom have appeared in the PBS series since its first season in 2010 - will be among those coming back for the movie. Focus Features and Universal Pictures International will distribute the film around the world.

The show's creator, Julian Fellowes, wrote the film's screenplay and will produce the picture alongside Carnival Films' Gareth Naeme, Liz Trubridge, and executive producer Nigel Marchant. Brian Percival, who helmed the show's pilot episode, will direct. Plot details are still under wraps.

Downton Abbey, set in the wealthy Crawley family's country estate, followed their intricate lives as well as those of the servants they employed at the turn of the 20th century. The show garnered a steady international following and sustained critical acclaim, winning three Golden Globes and 15 Emmys on top of 69 total nominations over the years.

"When the television series drew to a close, it was our dream to bring the millions of global fans a movie," said Naeme in a press statement. "Now, after getting many stars aligned, we are shortly to go into production. Julian's script charms, thrills, and entertains, and in Brian Percival's hands, we aim to deliver everything that one would hope for as Downton comes to the big screen."

This news has left many fans emotional and nostalgic. The show has a special place in the hearts of many and the fact that it's coming back in a cinematic form is a dream come true for many fans. The cast members have all been part of something special and it's hard to believe that they will be coming back together to bring this story to life once again. We can't wait to see what they have in store for us.

This is not the first time Garfield has donned drag. In 2014, he stunned in a long blonde wig and a lace white dress for Arcade Fire's music video for "We Exist." His bravery and willingness to embrace the unknown have earned him newfound respect and appreciation from fans around the world.

Lawrence clarified that she had only met Brad Pitt once, in 2013, and it was a very casual encounter. She added that she wasn't in a rush to dispel the rumor.

Since Brad Pitt's separation from Angelina Jolie in September 2016, he has been linked with various women, including Jennifer Lawrence. However, the actor has not confirmed any of these rumors.

In related news, Jennifer Lawrence was previously in a relationship with Darren Aronofsky, the director of her film Mother! In a recent interview with Vanity Fair, she spoke about their time together and how they remain friends and creative partners even after they ended their romantic relationship.

During her appearance on Watch What Happens Live, Lawrence also revealed a note that her friend Amy Schumer sent her after she broke up with Darren. The actress was emotional when talking about the incident, but her reaction suggested that she was okay being single.

To end the segment on a high note, host Andy Cohen surprised Lawrence with a "dinner party" featuring Real Housewives of New York City cast members Luann de Lesseps and Bethenny Frankel, as well as a cardboard cutout of Keeping Up with the Kardashians star Scott Disick. Lawrence seemed delighted by the gesture and enjoyed spending time with the housewives.

A Spanish publication, Magazine de Fuera de Serie, has sparked controversy with its latest cover. The cover features a painting of Michelle Obama's head superimposed on the body of a slave, created by French artist Marie-Guilhelmine Benoist in 1800. The first lady is depicted draped in an American flag and wearing a headscarf with her breast exposed. The headline reads, "Michelle Granddaughter of a Slave, Lady of America." Critics argue that this is a racist interpretation of modern-day politics.

Sophia Thomalla is a German model, actress, and TV presenter, born on October 6, 1989, in Berlin. She grew up in Berlin and Cologne and studied acting and singing at the Constantin School in Bochum from 2007 to 2009. As a model, she has appeared in campaigns for Axe deodorant and attempted to participate in Germany's Next Top Model but was eliminated after one episode.

Sophia Thomalla has been romantically linked with Gavin Rossdale, a rocker and coach on The Voice, since March 2017. Prior to her relationship with Gavin Rossdale, Sophia Thomalla was married to Norwegian rock singer Andy LaPlegua of the band Icon of Coil on March 11, 2016, after one year of dating. She had previously dated German rock star Till Lindemann of the band Rammstein.

In addition to her modeling career, Sophia Thomalla has also worked as a TV presenter and appeared on Let's Dance (Germany's Strictly Come Dancing) in 2010. She has also judged the German version of Dance, Dance, Dance in 2016.

The 2018 Emmy Awards have arrived, a time to celebrate the greatest television achievements of the past year. On Monday, September 17, viewers will be treated to a night of emotional recognition as the winners are announced.

The major awards are divided into two categories: comedy and drama. On the drama side, The Handmaid's Tale, the freshman series that took home several awards in its first year, is once again in the running for Outstanding Drama Series. The grim, dystopian adaptation of Margaret Atwood's novel was praised for its Outstanding Writing in a Drama Series and Outstanding Drama Series. Additionally, the Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series prize will be awarded to series star Elisabeth Moss, who has finally won an Emmy after seven prior nominations.

On the comedy side, the nominations field is crowded with eight series vying for the main prize. However, reigning champ Veep is missing as the show's final season was delayed while its star, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, underwent treatment for cancer. Among the contenders for the Outstanding Comedy Series throne are newcomer The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel and the second season of Donald Glover's Atlanta. The rest of the Outstanding Comedy Series nominees include Barry, GLOW, Silicon Valley, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, and Curb Your Enthusiasm.

While some shows were overlooked in certain categories, Killing Eve's star, Sandra Oh, made history as the first woman of Asian descent to be nominated for a Lead Actress Emmy.

NBC will broadcast the 2018 Emmy Awards show live on Monday, with Saturday Night Live's Colin Jost and Michael Che hosting. The complete list of nominees can be found on the Emmys' website.

As the night of recognition approaches, let us take a moment to reflect on the emotional impact of television. From the laughter and tears that come with binge-watching a new show to the heartbreak and hope that comes with watching a character's journey unfold, television has the power to bring us together in a way that no other medium can.

Here's to the winners and nominees of the 2018 Emmy Awards. May their hard work and dedication be recognized and celebrated.

The Parents Television Council (PTC) released a report analyzing the content of 280 popular YouTube videos from March to October 2008. The report found that many child-friendly search terms led to highly offensive content, including extremely graphic content and harsh profanity. The PTC's President, Tim Winter, stated that the results of the study should serve as a wake-up call for parents concerned about graphic or indecent material on websites they perceive as safe for their children. The report concluded that YouTube is not doing enough to protect children from inappropriate material, as its gating procedures do not extend to text commentary, and that many popular search terms produce videos linked to ads for triple-X pornography without requiring age verification. The PTC has previously commended YouTube for its commitment to gating procedures and its plans to curb inappropriate content.

Rihanna's career has been marked by an array of breathtaking and unforgettable looks, leaving us all in awe of her fashion prowess. From her satsuma orange mini dress to her canary yellow Guo Pei gown, Rihanna has proven that she has the power to make anything look absolutely divine. But what is it about her style that sets her apart from the rest?

The answer is simple, yet oh so profound. Rihanna doesn't care what the world thinks. She wears what she wants, and she wears it with unapologetic confidence. Whether it's a bright red hair color paired with a purple jumper, coral trousers, and metallic gold shoes, or a satsuma orange mini dress, Rihanna is fearless in her choices.

And it's not just her red carpet looks that have made her a fashion icon. Rihanna's off-duty wardrobe is just as bold and unapologetic. She can pull off a full camo puffer look with ease, or wear a baggy t-shirt and tights with a classic denim mini skirt and shirt, and still look like a total boss. The only thing that matters to her is that she feels good in what she's wearing, and that's something that we all aspire to.

Last night, Rihanna made her long-awaited return to music, and she made sure to make her presence felt with a dramatic red carpet appearance. Wearing a khaki green Rick Owens gown from the designer's autumn/winter 2022 collection, Rihanna added a touch of drama with a pair of opera gloves, heavy-tousled hair, and pointed sandals, revealing the most perfect white pedicure we've ever seen.

We've missed you, Rihanna. Your fearless and unapologetic style is something that we all aspire to emulate. Thank you for inspiring us to be true to ourselves and to wear what we love, regardless of what anyone else thinks.

The new comedy film "Snatched," starring Amy Schumer and Goldie Hawn, has left audiences both in stitches and in tears. While many critics have praised the movie for its "good, raunchy fun," others have harshly criticized it for its lackluster plot and stereotypical portrayal of Latin American characters.

The film follows the journey of a social media obsessed young woman and her prude mother as they embark on a trip that quickly goes wrong. Positive reviews have noted that the movie is a "return to form" for Hawn and a chance for Schumer to show her range. However, some have argued that the film is ultimately "complacent, self-absorbed, and clueless," and that it takes no risks and blazes no trails.

Despite its mixed reviews, "Snatched" hits theaters on May 12 and is expected to be a box office success. Whether you love the movie or hate it, one thing is certain: it will leave you feeling emotions that range from laughter to tears.

In an accompanying video, Cox opens up about being "kept a secret" by previous romantic partners, as a black transgender woman. Cox continues, "Trans women deserve to be loved out in the open and in the light." Her message is clear, and it's one that we all need to hear.

Stedman Graham was born on March 6, 1951, in New Jersey. He is an American educator, author, businessman, and public speaker, and has been the long-term partner of Oprah Winfrey since 1986.

Graham received a bachelor's degree in social work from Hardin-Simmons University in 1974 and a master's degree in education from Ball State University in 1979. He played college basketball at Hardin-Simmons and was roomed with future NBA basketball player Harvey Catchings.

After college, Graham moved to North Carolina to establish himself in public relations. He worked at B & C Associates, where he represented black causes and worked with clients such as Maya Angelou and Winnie Mandela. He is also the founder of AAD, a non-profit organization that provides services to youth and has awarded over $1.5 million in scholarships since its founding in 1985.

In 1988, Graham created S. Graham & Associates, a corporate and educational marketing and consulting firm. He has been an adjunct professor at Full Sail University.

Graham has written several self-help and business-related books, including "The Ultimate Guide to Sport Event Management and Marketing," "You Can Make It Happen: A Nine-Step Plan for Success," and "Move Without the Ball: Put Your Skills and Your Magic to Work for You." He has also written articles for The Huffington Post and the College Board School Counseling Series.

Graham was a tennis instructor at the Denver Country Club when he met Robin Robinson, a news anchor on KMGH-TV. They were in a relationship from 1982 to 1986. Since 1986, Graham has been in an ongoing relationship with Oprah Winfrey, with whom he was conferred an honorary degree by Notre Dame de Namur University of Belmont, Calif., in 2019.

"Tonight, Prince Harry accepted the prestigious Legacy Award on behalf of his late mother, Princess Diana, at Attitude magazine's glittering ceremony. The UK's leading gay magazine honored Diana for her pioneering charity work with people suffering from AIDS, recognizing her bravery in challenging the stigmas associated with the disease.

In a powerful and emotional speech, Harry recalled the iconic moment when Diana shook hands with an AIDS patient in the late '80s, inspiring the world to embrace compassion and education. "In April 1987, my mother was just 25 years old, but she had a responsibility to speak out against the ignorance surrounding AIDS," he said. "She knew that the misunderstanding of this disease was exacerbated by homophobia, and so she chose to use her platform to challenge everyone to educate themselves and show empathy towards those affected."

Harry, like his mother, has been a tireless advocate for those affected by HIV/AIDS. In 2006, he founded Sentebale, a charity that supports children in Africa affected by the disease. He also bravely got tested for HIV with Rihanna in Barbados to raise awareness on World AIDS Day in 2016.

Diana's legacy of compassion and philanthropy lives on through her children, and her impact will never be forgotten."

"The Brady Bunch Reunion: Kids Reunite, Mourn Loss of Florence Henderson, and Pay Tribute to TV Mom"

After 48 long years, the beloved TV family of "The Brady Bunch" has reunited to pay tribute to their TV mom, Florence Henderson, who passed away in November. The four kids - Greg (Barry Williams), Peter (Christopher Knight), Bobby (Mike Lookinland), and Cindy (Susan Olsen) - appeared on the Today show on Tuesday to talk about the impact the show still has today.

"Florence had a way of making everyone feel better about themselves and the world around them," Knight said about the legendary actress. "She was a mentor, a friend, and we all learned from her."

Lookinland also shared his thoughts on the late TV mom. "Florence had the ability to lighten the room and the mood, and she just did it naturally. We all benefited from that," he said.

The cast also opened up about aging with the show and how it keeps them forever young. "The show keeps us young in everyone's mind, but we're really this old," Knight explained. "We're still the kids."

ET spoke to the late Henderson in June, when she envisioned what a Brady Bunch reboot would look like today. "She was excited about the idea of a reboot," she said. "I think it would be a great opportunity to introduce new audiences to the show and the family."

Seven-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has responded to John McEnroe's claim that she would struggle to be ranked in the top 700 of the men's circuit.

McEnroe, who was ranked 701 in the world at the time, made the controversial statement on a US radio station NPR, stating that Williams would be ranked 700 if she played on the men's circuit. He qualified his comments by noting that anything is possible, but has not seen such a phenomenon in tennis.

However, Russian player Dmitry Tursunov, who was ranked 701 in the world, has stated that he believes he could beat Williams. Speaking to the BBC World Service Sport, Tursunov acknowledged that men are generally stronger in tennis, but argued that Williams' physical prowess would make her a formidable opponent.

"Tennis is becoming more and more a physical sport," Tursunov said. "So it's going to be hard for a woman to beat the men."

Tursunov also noted that Williams is pregnant, while he is not, which could be a factor in the argument. He added that he did not believe McEnroe was "trying to talk women's tennis down," but acknowledged that "men are stronger in general."

The issue of men and women competing in tennis has come up several times in the past, with notable exhibitions such as the 1973 "Battle of the Sexes" match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs. More recently, Jimmy Connors and Martina Navratilova played an exhibition match in 1992 under special rules to make it more competitive.

"Breaking News: Survivor Star Zeke Smith Reveals Who Really Outed Him!

In a shocking turn of events, Survivor star Zeke Smith has revealed who he believes was responsible for outing him as trans on the show. Smith explained that he was drawn to Survivor because of the show's integrity in storytelling, and that he only revealed his trans status later in the relationship. He had a chat with Probst and they agreed that how and when he would talk about his trans identity was up to him, not the show.

So who really outed Zeke Smith? Smith's interview with The Talk doesn't give away who is responsible, leaving many questions unanswered. It seems that CBS should take some responsibility and do the same."

On Saturday, a 38-year-old man named Julius Sandrock was arrested outside a Beverly Hills home owned by singer Taylor Swift. Sandrock was wearing a mask and had a knife in his car when he was taken into custody. He was released from custody on Tuesday while police continue their investigation.

According to the temporary restraining order obtained by police, Sandrock was wearing a mask and rubber gloves when he was taken into custody. He told police he had driven from his home in Broomfield, Colo., to see Swift. He also told the officers that he owned three handguns and was on probation in Colorado for firing one.

A search of his car turned up a knife, rope, ammunition, and more masks and gloves. Prescription medications, including oxycodone, were also found, and Sandrock told the arresting officers that he had depression, bipolar disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and manic episodes.

The arrest followed the April 8 arrest of a homeless man, Justin Lilly, 23, who was charged with a misdemeanour and sentenced to three days in jail for trespassing at the same property and ignoring warnings by security guards to leave the area. Swift was not at home at the time of either arrest.

In related news, another man who violated a restraining order and threatened to kill Swift was sentenced to 10 years probation in early April. Frank Andrew Hoover was first arrested in November 2016 after violating his restraining order when he followed Swift after her concert at a Formula 1 race. Hoover was ordered to keep at least a mile from Swift and her family, and to undergo psychological testing, substance abuse classes, and random drug testing. If he violates these terms, he faces jail time.

"This is sweet," he wrote. "Wait until this poor kid grows up, realizes what you've done, and stuffs both of you dismembered into a freezer in the garage." The tweet was cold, callous, and cruel, and Neil Patrick Harris couldn't stand by and watch it.

In response, Harris called Woods "utterly ignorant and classless," reminding him that he didn't know the true meaning behind the family's actions. "I'm friends with this family," Harris wrote. "You know not of what you speak, and should be ashamed of yourself."

But Woods' words didn't just hurt Harris and his friends. They also hurt the family themselves. Lori Duron, the mother in the photograph, wrote a heartbreaking blog post titled "My Gender Creative Son's First Pride." In it, she expressed her pride in her son and the love she has for him.

Woods' tweet was not just an attack on one family, but on all those who have faced discrimination andÊéíÊñ• for their gender identity. Organizations like GLAAD exist to support and celebrate those who are different, and Woods' words were a reminder that there is still much work to be done.

As we continue to move forward in a world where love and acceptance are paramount, let us remember to be kind, to listen, and to never forget the importance of empathy and understanding.

Overall, Judd expressed enthusiasm for the upcoming season of Berlin Station and her appreciation for the show's themes of political intrigue and female empowerment.

The internet is in a frenzy over the color of a sneaker, leaving people emotionally divided and heartbroken. A Twitter user @TFILDOLANS posted a photo of the shoe, sparking a heated debate that quickly spiraled out of control. The picture shows the sneaker appears gray with teal accents to some, while others see pink with white accents.

Many people are confused and heartbroken over the true color of the shoe. One user asks, "So is it actually grey and teal or pink and white?" Another adds, "PEOPLE R SAYING ITS PINK N WHITE??? LIKE ITS GREY AND LIGHT BLUE/TEAL LIKE WTFF." A third user even becomes confrontational, writing, "ITS [sic] PINK & WHITE FIGHT ME."

However, the user later admits she didn't own the sneaker, and Twitter user @dolansmalik revealed he was the owner of the shoe, which is actually pink and white. He explained that the picture was taken "with flash and darkened," causing it to appear teal and gray for some people. The color looks different for others depending on the lighting.

This photo has resurrected the color debate that overtook the internet in 2015 with "the dress." That controversial picture, which was posted on Tumblr, appeared black and blue to some, but white and gold to others. People are still taking sides in that photo today, leaving them emotionally torn and heartbroken.

This sneaker debate has left people feeling lost and confused, leaving them to question the very fabric of their reality. It's a reminder that even the most seemingly minor details can have a profound impact on our emotions, and it's important to be kind and understanding in the face of these differences.

The cancellation of Fox's "Lucifer" has left fans heartbroken and creators devastated. The DC Entertainment series, which was axed in May, averaged a 1.3 rating among adults 18-49 and nearly 5 million viewers in its third season. Despite a massive fan campaign, Netflix has decided to revive the show for a fourth season, leaving many to wonder why such a beloved series was cancelled in the first place.

"Lucifer" never really set the ratings afire, but it had a dedicated fan base that fought hard to keep the show alive. The series ended on a cliffhanger, leaving fans heartbroken and creators gutted. Creator Joe Henderson tweeted out that the axing "fucking hurts," and star Tom Ellis tweeted that he was "gutted" by the cancellation.

As Netflix picks up the show, it is clear that the Peak TV era offers more choices where one outlet's miss is another's hit. It also is worth noting that Netflix didn't even have the SVOD rights to "Lucifer" - Hulu did - meaning that deal had to be reworked, similar to the way Amazon recently revived Syfy's "The Expanse" after having to renegotiate SVOD rights as the first three seasons were sold to Netflix.

This cancellation comes as Fox undergoes a dramatic shift amid its studio counterpart's pending sale to Disney (or Comcast). Gone are niche comedies like "Brooklyn Nine-Nine" and narrow dramas like "Lucifer," as Fox plots a shift to broader audiences with a slate of procedurals and multicamera comedies. It is clear that the cancellation of "Lucifer" is a reflection of these changes, leaving many to wonder what the future holds for this beloved series and its dedicated fan base.

The world was captivated when Serena Williams walked down the aisle on her Nov. 16 wedding day to Alexis Ohanian. However, the stunning bride was not accompanied by her father, Richard Williams.

In the third episode of the HBO documentary Being Serena, the tennis star revealed that Richard sent her a heartbreaking text just one hour before the ceremony. "Serena, I don't want you to be mad at me, but I just can't walk you down the aisle. I'm not myself anymore. I'm just too nervous," he wrote.

Serena's response was full of grace and understanding. "Daddy, it's okay, if you don't want to come to the wedding at all, that's okay too. I'm not going to be upset with you about it, so I don't want you to be upset about it," she wrote back.

The 36-year-old athlete, who welcomed daughter Alexis Olympia just two months before her wedding, explained that she knew why her father felt uncomfortable. "Maybe a lot of daughters wouldn't react the same way, but I know the struggles he's had these last few years. His health is better now, but I know he still doesn't feel like himself, doesn't feel like he's perfect," she said. "And if he doesn't want to be up there in front of a lot of people, I completely understand."

Despite the sudden change of plans, Serena walked down the aisle solo as violinists performed "How Far I'll Go" from the movie Moana. Her grace and composure inspired all who witnessed it.

Meanwhile, Serena's friend Meghan Markle will also be without her father on her upcoming wedding day. In a statement from Kensington Palace, Meghan confirmed that Thomas Markle would not be attending her wedding to Prince Harry this Saturday. "Sadly, my father will not be attending our wedding. As for Richard, he underwent heart surgery and was hospitalized following a week of statements about his health. A royal source told PEOPLE that Meghan's father "has told Meghan he cannot attend due to medical reasons."

Meghan and Harry are due to marry at St. George's Chapel at Windsor Castle on Saturday. The decision on who will walk Meghan down the aisle will be made "in due course," a palace source told PEOPLE.

On Thursday, November 16, radio personality Leeann Tweeden accused Minnesota Senator and comedian Al Franken of placing her in a compromising position without her consent during a USO Tour in 2006. In a blog post published by her radio station KABC, Tweeden detailed her encounter with Franken backstage before a show.

According to Tweeden, Franken had written a skit for the show and brought props and costumes to accompany it. The skit featured Tweeden and a kiss, which she felt was unnecessary and made her uncomfortable. Tweeden writes that Franken repeatedly insisted they rehearse the kiss, despite her protests. When they finally did the line leading up to the kiss, Franken came at her aggressively and placed his hand on her head, mashing his lips against hers and sticking his tongue in her mouth. Tweeden writes that she pushed him away and felt violated and humiliated.

Tweeden also alleges that Franken groped her without her consent while she was asleep on the tour's journey home. She writes that she found a photo of Franken putting his hands on her breasts while she slept.

Franken released a statement shortly after the accusations, apologizing to Tweeden and others involved in the tour, as well as to everyone who works for him and counts on him as an ally and champion of women. He stated that he respects women and does not respect men who do not, and that he will cooperate with an ethics investigation.

Tweeden's allegations come amid a growing wave of sexual misconduct scandals in Hollywood and beyond. In 2017, the New York Times and the New Yorker published investigative pieces accusing movie producer Harvey Weinstein of decades of sexual assault and harassment. Other celebrities have since come forward with their own accounts of sexual misconduct.

Amber Heard, who is married to Johnny Depp, discusses her experiences as a wife and actress in a recent interview with ELLE magazine.

"Nothing is a dramatic change," Heard says about her marriage to the A-list actor. "We've been together for a long time now, so it's been a fairly organic process. I have a fiercely independent spirit."

Despite her success, Heard also expresses her fear of losing her freedom and the ability to travel freely. "The thing that really scares me is the potential of losing my freedom," she says. "I never want for my life to lose the ability to transverse the world, with freedom and ease."

Heard also notes that she feels pressure to conform to certain beauty standards due to her appearance, calling it a "Barbie box." "I feel like I'm constantly fighting against my exterior, or this exterior presentation of myself because of how I look or perhaps because of who I'm with," she says.

In terms of her career, Heard criticizes the lack of diverse roles for women in film, saying that many scripts feature "placeholder girls" that serve mainly to validate the male character's personality traits. "So really her job is to validate this personality trait of our hero or male," she says.

Heard's next big-screen role is in Magic Mike XXL, out July 1, and she will appear on the cover of ELLE magazine's June 23 issue.

In a tragic accident that has left the surfing community in shock, Zander Venezia, a 16-year-old pro surfer from Bridgetown, Barbados, lost his life while riding the massive waves caused by Hurricane Irma in Barbados on Tuesday.

According to multiple reports, Venezia was surfing the dangerous "Box by Box" break on the east side of the Caribbean island when he was caught by a closeout set that plunged him into the shallow, rocky bottom where he hit his head on a reef and drowned.

The young athlete had won the top prize of $250 at the Rip Curl Grom Search in North Carolina just two weeks ago and was in Barbados with fellow surfers Nathan Florence, Dylan Graves, Balaram Stack and Asher Nolan, as well as photographers Daniel Russo and Jimmy Wilson.

As surfers hit the waves Tuesday morning, Florence spotted Venezia's board floating in the water and rushed to his aid. However, despite their efforts, Venezia could not be saved and was pronounced dead at the hospital later that day.

Autopsy results reported Wednesday revealed that he suffered no fractures, but the news of his sudden and tragic death has left his friends and family devastated.

"I'm going to miss you so much Zander!" said Nolan, who watched Venezia's last surf and described him as "humble, respectful, full of positive energy."

"Gone too soon," he continued. "My heart is heavy. The Venezias always treated me like family and it hurts that they have to go through losing someone so special."

"This saddens me in a way that my stomach actually hurts," said friend Patrick Ruddy. "I'm floored by the news this morning that our good friend @zandervenezia passed away doing what we all love, surfing at home and enjoying the ocean."

Former Bajan pro-turned-surf instructor Alan Burke, who was among those trying to save Venezia, told Surfline that the young athlete was a "good, funny kid" who loved surfing and was always joking around.

"We are in shambles over here," he said. "Zander was such a good, funny kid. He was always joking, and he just loved surfing. He was so jovial, such a joy to be around. I just can't believe he's gone. I'm a mess, man. We're all a mess over here."

The news of Venezia's death comes just days after Hurricane Irma hit Puerto Rico and is set to make landfall in Florida.

Paramount Pictures has announced that Leonardo DiCaprio will star in and produce an adaptation of Stephan Talty's book "The Black Hand." The true story follows Joe Petrosino, an NYPD cop who went after the ruthless gang in the early 1900s. The thugs, known for their calling card of a black hand, migrated from Italy to America and kidnapped people to extort money from their families. Talty is the New York Times-bestselling author of six nonfiction books focused on history and individual achievement. As a ghostwriter, Talty's work included "A Captain's Duty," which was the basis for the 2013 Oscar-nominated Tom Hanks-starrer "Captain Phillips." DiCaprio recently starred in "Before the Flood," a 2016 documentary about climate change directed by Fisher Stevens, and will next play Sam Phillips, a pioneer in the music industry during the 1950s who helped launch the careers of Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, and Jerry Lee Lewis. Paramount has been busy acquiring material for DiCaprio following his new first-look deal, which he signed in 2015. Appain Way is developing a reboot of the "Captain Planet" series with Glen Powell, among its many projects. DiCaprio is repped by LBI Entertainment. The news was first reported by Deadline Hollywood.

Oh, my dear reader, the time has come‚Äîthe moment we have all been eagerly anticipating: Pippa Middleton is set to marry James Matthews this weekend in London. (Alas, it's not too late to book your ticket now to London‚Äîyou won't be able to attend the wedding itself, but you can still sort of camp out nearby and listen for sounds.)

There are countless spreadsheets and binders dedicated to making sure everything goes smoothly for Kate's sister's nuptials, and most of the plans remain shrouded in secrecy. But what we do know, per a new E! report, is how Pippa, reportedly, has been preparing for the wedding.

The outlet claims that Pippa has undergone a "strict bridal body boot camp," a three-month program run out of Grace Belgravia health club. The program, in its description, doesn't sound too different from an (intensive) gym membership that you might read about a famous person partaking in; the components include "a personal trainer, skincare and leg toning treatments, plus yoga, pilates, spinning, cardio training, dance and meditation classes" and "the club also offers to arrange home deliveries of specialized healthy meals."

Oh, wait, there's also this, which sounds positively Paltrow-ian: "The club also has a team of doctors and specialists who can help with anti-aging treatments including botox, peels, fillers, microdermabrasion and an assortment of laser treatments, as well as IV therapies." E! notes, of course, that it is "unclear if Pippa has undergone such procedures."

Her diet is the healthiest ever‚Äîshe hasn't even had a glass of wine in months. She's had facial treatments sometimes once a week or once a fortnight."

This truly is an impressive feat, as, just over the course of writing this post, we have finished off two glasses of wine and did not complete a single facial treatment.

It has been reported that two major UK publications, The Sun and Metro, have had to withdraw articles that purportedly featured interviews with Justin Bieber. However, it has since emerged that the supposed quotes from the singer were fake.

It is believed that both publications ran articles online featuring quotes from the superstar, but it has been confirmed that he did not actually speak with either outlet.

Gossip Cop has explained what happened. On Sunday, it was reported that Metro had conducted an interview with Bieber. However, it has since been revealed that the entire interview was fabricated and never actually took place.

Similarly, it was reported that The Sun had conducted an interview with Bieber. However, Gossip Cop has confirmed that the supposed interview was also fake and never took place.

It is unclear how these fake interviews came to be created or why the publications decided to run with them. However, it is important to note that the quotes from Bieber were not based on any actual conversations he had.

It is not the first time that fake interviews have been conducted with Bieber. In 2019, it was reported that a fake interview with him had been conducted by a Canadian radio station.

It is important for publications to verify the accuracy of their sources before publishing articles, as fake interviews can cause harm to individuals' reputations and can damage the credibility of the publication itself.

Kendall Jenner, the highest paid supermodel in 2017, has come under fire for comments she made about being selective about the runway shows she walks in.

In an interview with Love magazine, Jenner stated that she "was never one of those girls who would do like 30 shows a season or whatever the (expletive) those girls do." She later added, "I had a million jobs, not only catwalks but everything else."

These comments have been met with criticism from the modelling community. Model Ginta Lapina shared a screenshot of Jenner's quote on Instagram, writing, "We all are hard working and worked hard to be where we are. Nothing was given to us." Lapina also posted an Instagram story of herself during a shoot, writing "I gotta work" with the hashtag #ImNotKardashian.

Model Peyton Knight added her own hashtag, #EndThePrivilege, over Jenner's image in her Instagram story. "This kinda disrespect towards other models who have NO NAME for themselves walking into the industry is disgusting," she wrote. "We don't get to 'choose' which shows to do."

Russian model Daria Strokous responded to Jenner's comment, saying, " 'Whatever the (expletive) those girls do' is do their very best to make their way up AND try to make some money so that they can provide for themselves and their families," she shared on her Instagram Story. "Oh, and it's 70 shows a season by the way."

Sports Illustrated swimsuit model Vita Sidorkina-Morabito had "no words" in a comment under Love's post, while male model Xavier Serrano called Jenner's interview disrespectful. "How you even dare to say that!" he wrote on Instagram. "Disrespect to all the models that we have to build our own way in the industry! (99% of us)."

Jenner's representative, Ina Treciokas, said the quote was taken out of context. "The quote was not what she meant," Treciokas said in a statement. "The point was that it's their path and 'the more power to them'. She admires their hard work and dedication. It's an accomplishment." Jenner herself addressed the controversy in a series of tweets, saying she was "misrepresented" in the interview.

In her tweets, Jenner said she scaled back on her modelling duties because she was "overwhelmed" and "on the verge of a mental breakdown." She also expressed her admiration for the modelling community and her respect for their hard work and dedication.
