Actor Casey Affleck has spoken publicly for the first time since allegations of sexual harassment resurfaced, discussing his decision to skip the 2018 Oscars and his regret over past incidents.

Affleck, who won Best Actor for Manchester by the Sea in 2017, was scheduled to present the Best Actress award at this year's ceremony but instead actresses Jodie Foster and Jennifer Lawrence presented the award. Affleck stated that he believed it was the right decision given the current cultural climate, and that presenting the award to actresses who had shown courage and wisdom in speaking out against sexual harassment was the right thing to do.

The allegations against Affleck relate to incidents that occurred during the production of the 2010 Joaquin Phoenix pseudo-documentary I'm Still Here, for which Affleck served as director. Although Affleck denied any wrongdoing, he ultimately settled both lawsuits.

During his Best Actor campaign for Manchester by the Sea, the allegations of harassment were brought to light again, and actress Brie Larson and others refused to clap for Affleck. In response to these allegations, Affleck expressed regret for being involved in a lawsuit and stated that he wished he had found a different way to resolve the situation.

Affleck also discussed the impact of the #MeToo and Time's Up movements on Hollywood, stating that women have historically been underrepresented, underpaid, objectified, and belittled in the industry, and that it is only recently that these issues have begun to receive more attention and attention. He emphasized the need for women to continue to speak out against sexual harassment and for men to listen and support them in their efforts.

Finally, Affleck talked about his upcoming film Light of My Life and his final acting role in Robert Redford's The Old Man & The Gun.

Anmer Hall is a Georgian country house located in the village of Anmer, Norfolk, England. The house was built in 1802 and has been owned by various individuals and organizations over the years. After Queen Victoria purchased the property, it was acquired by the Sandringham Estate, which is the current owner. The house has been leased to business owners, civil servants, members of the British royal family, and has served as the country residence of the Prince and Princess of Wales. It was given to the couple as a wedding gift by Elizabeth II and underwent a ¬£1.5 million refurbishment program funded by private royal family funds. The house features a mix of contemporary and antique designs, and has a swimming pool and tennis court. The surrounding estate became a scheduled monument in 2003 and includes earthworks marking the sites of buildings from the medieval village of Anmer. The village church, St Mary, is located close to the house, but the modern village is a short distance away. The house is situated 12 miles northeast of King's Lynn, 2 miles east of the King's residence at Sandringham, and 2 miles west of Houghton Hall.

"HUGH DANE, the beloved actor who played Hank the security guard on the hit NBC comedy The Office, has passed away at the age of 75 from pancreatic cancer, according to his death certificate obtained by TMZ.

Steve Carell and Rainn Wilson, who also starred on The Office, expressed their condolences on Twitter. "RIP Hugh Dane, aka Hank the security guard. He was one of the greats. So kind, funny, talented. We will all miss him," Wilson wrote. Carell simply tweeted, "What a terrific guy."

Dane, who was born on Oct. 21, 1942, worked in the entertainment industry for 40 years. He passed away on May 16 at 10:56 p.m. The Office cast and friends mourn the loss of this beloved actor."

Jennifer Lopez, whose parents originated from Puerto Rico, was raised in the Bronx and shared a bedroom with her two sisters. In 2013, she received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and the following year, she became the first female artist to receive a Billboard Icon Award. Her net worth is estimated to be over $300 million.

While her success was undeniable, Lopez faced personal challenges. She experienced several box office flops and went through three marriages, including one with Marc Anthony, the father of her twins. She has also learned to navigate her success, stating, "When you have that type of success at a young age, you have to navigate it, almost survive it." Despite these challenges, she has continued to grow and improve herself, her relationships, and her life in general.

I once believed that these boots were the perfect fit for my calves, despite the claims that they were designed for smaller calf sizes and ran small. However, I was devastated to find that they were both false. Even with thick socks, I found that the boots looked and felt a half size larger than they should be.

In addition, the boots were too big for my 13.5 calf, and the whole back bulged off my calf all the way down, as another reviewer had mentioned. I was unable to adjust the tie to make them fit any smaller. In the end, I had no choice but to return the boots.

Despite this, I did appreciate the appearance and comfort of the boots. They looked and felt nice, and I would recommend them to any woman, regardless of her average calf size. However, I wish I had known that they would be too large for me before ordering them, as I could have saved myself the disappointment and frustration of having to return them.

On Wednesday, President Trump revoked protections for transgender students that allowed them to use bathrooms corresponding with their gender identity. This decision was made despite opposition from his own education secretary and places his administration in the middle of the ongoing cultural wars that some Republicans have sought to avoid.

The Justice Department and the Education Department issued a joint letter rejecting the Obama administration's position that non-discrimination laws require schools to allow transgender students to use the bathrooms of their choice. They argued that this directive was improperly and arbitrarily devised, as it did not take into account the primary role of states and local school districts in establishing educational policy.

The decision to revoke these protections opened a rift within the Trump administration, with Education Secretary Betsy DeVos and Attorney General Jeff Sessions at odds over the issue. Sessions, who had been expected to move quickly to roll back civil rights expansions, wanted to act decisively due to two court cases pending that could have upheld the protections and led to further litigation.

EXCLUSIVE: Miranda Kerr and Evan Spiegel Welcome Baby Hart, Their First Child Together!

The world is abuzz with excitement as Miranda Kerr and her Snapchat CEO husband, Evan Spiegel, announce the arrival of their first child together! The baby boy was born on Monday, May 7 at 11:53 p.m. in Los Angeles, People confirms. The couple's little miracle has been named Hart, after Evan's grandfather.

In a statement to People, the thrilled parents-to-be said, "Words cannot explain how happy we are to welcome our beautiful son into our family. Miranda is doing well and Flynn is excited to be a big brother. Thank you for the kind words and wishes during this very special time."

This is not the first time Miranda, 35, has expanded her family. She's also a proud mom to seven-year-old Flynn, whom she shares with her ex-husband, Orlando Bloom.

Miranda and Evan, 27, tied the knot in a small, intimate ceremony at their Brentwood, California home in May 2017. The model and Snapchat CEO reportedly first met in 2014 when they were seated together at a Louis Vuitton dinner. After dating for just over a year, they announced their engagement in July 2016.

Miranda recently gushed about their wedding, saying, "Our wedding was just so joyful. We started the day, did yoga, then our families came over and we literally had this celebration in our backyard. It was incredible. It was so magical."

News of Miranda's pregnancy first broke in November 2017. A spokesperson for the Victoria's Secret alum said at the time, "Miranda, Evan, and Flynn are looking forward to welcoming the newest member of their family."

And the proof is in the pudding! Miranda debuted her baby bump on the red carpet in January at a Golden Globes afterparty in a body-hugging leopard print gown.

Congratulations to this beautiful couple on the arrival of their little miracle!

Julianne Hough, the beloved Dancing with the Stars judge, and Brooks Laich, a NHL star, tied the knot in a breathtaking outdoor wedding on July 8th in Idaho. The couple exchanged vows on Lake Coeur d'Alene, a place where Hough spent her summers growing up. "When I introduced Brooks to the lake, he fell in love with this special spot, and we knew this was where we wanted to raise our family and grow old together," Hough, 28, told PEOPLE in an exclusive interview.

Designed by event planner Troy Williams, the wedding weekend was a celebration of love and nature, both of which were essential to the bride and groom. "It was really important to me that we had our ceremony outdoors," Laich, 34, said. "Julianne and I are very adventurous and free, and wanted the setting to be in nature."

More than 2,000 blooms were used to create the floral arrangements, all designed by Kristen Griffith-VanderYacht of Wild Bloom, including 100 flower boxes and at least 200 garden roses in the reception centerpieces. After the wedding, Hough and Laich donated all the flowers to The Full Bloom, a non-profit organization that repurposes gently used flowers into bouquets for patients in area hospitals, hospice care and other facilities.

During the ceremony, Hough wore a custom strapless sweetheart Marchesa gown and Laich wore a Brooks Brothers tuxedo. They exchanged traditional vows and exchanged Lorraine Schwartz-designed rings. "Brooks and I kept eye contact the entire ceremony," Hough said. "We never stopped looking at each other." Her favorite moment was "kissing each other for the first time as husband and wife as the confetti cannons exploded around us."

After the ceremony, Hough was surprised by her bridesmaids and girlfriends with a choreographed dance number to Sia's song, "The Greatest," a favorite from Hough's recent tour with her brother, Derek. The bride surprised her groom as well ‚Äî with timed fireworks over the lake during their first dance to OneRepublic's "All This Time" (to which she also walked down the aisle).

Guests were given turn-down gifts each night, put together from the bride and groom by Gifts for the Good Life, which included a Happy Spritz facial mist, Sugarfina Bubbly Bears with a J&B monogrammed label, and a make-your-own margarita set with Casamigos Tequila or make-your-own lemonade kit, among other goodies.

Hough and Laich announced their engagement in August 2015 after dating for a year and a half. Their wedding weekend was "perfection," Hough said. "I don't think I ever really necessarily dreamed about my wedding as a kid. But I know I will always cherish and remember it for the rest of my life."

This story is a reminder that love is the most beautiful thing in the world, and that true love knows no bounds. Congratulations, Julianne and Brooks!

A former real estate investor and star of the Discovery Channel's "Property Wars" show was sentenced to 17 years in prison for a fraud scheme that targeted more than 200 victims and resulted in losses of over $30 million. Scott Menaged, 40, operated a real estate investment business and retail furniture stores in Phoenix, Arizona, and had also appeared on the popular TV show.

According to the U.S. Attorney's Office in Arizona, Menaged engaged in a multi-year fraud scheme that involved embezzling millions of dollars in loans meant for real estate purchases. He also provided fake real estate purchase documents to conceal the fraud and used the embezzled money to support a lavish lifestyle, including travel, million-dollar homes, and luxury vehicles.

When Menaged no longer had access to the embezzled funds, he orchestrated an elaborate identity theft scheme with the help of customers of his furniture stores. He used the personal identification information of recently deceased individuals and submitted fake credit applications from his furniture stores to various banks, resulting in more than $2 million in losses to the banks.

"Menaged engaged in a multi-year fraud scheme and brazenly stole from his victims ‚Äî their money, their identities, and ultimately their trust," said First Assistant U.S. Attorney Elizabeth A. Strange in a prepared statement. "Today's lengthy sentence is a fitting punishment for his egregious crimes."

U.S. District Judge G. Murray Snow also ordered Menaged to pay victims more than $33.5 million in restitution. The investigation was conducted by the Department of Homeland Security, Homeland Security Investigations, and Internal Revenue Service-Criminal Investigation.

This is a heart-wrenching story of a man who betrayed the trust of his victims and stole their identities to support his own luxurious lifestyle. It serves as a reminder to be cautious of financial scams and to protect ourselves and our loved ones from fraud.

In a shocking revelation, the widow of the late singer Chris Cornell has claimed that her husband's addiction to drugs was the primary cause of his untimely death.

Vicky Cornell, who spoke to ABC News' Robin Roberts in her first television interview since the family tragedy, said that Chris Cornell loved his life and would never have left the world. However, his battle with addiction led him to take drastic steps.

The former Soundgarden and Audioslave frontman's death was ruled an apparent suicide, but Vicky Cornell and others argue that there is more to the story. Medical reports found seven different drugs in his system, but these were not a contributing factor to his death.

Dr. Richard Cote, the chair of the department of pathology at the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine, conducted an independent analysis of Chris Cornell's autopsy and revealed that two drugs found in his system may have resulted in impaired judgment and motor functions.

Vicky Cornell also revealed that her husband fell back into addiction approximately a year before his death, after being sober since 2003. He took 20-something pills in a week and 33 pills in nine days.

The new drugs changed him, she said, and his brain became different from that of someone who doesn't have a substance use disorder. He relapsed, and just two months later, he walked off stage in the middle of what would turn out to be his final performance and died hours later in his hotel room.

Vicky Cornell said explaining what happened to her children the following day was "the most tragic thing you can ever go through." She added that she is now making it her mission to raise awareness and destigmatize addiction, and encourage others to speak openly about the topic.

‚ÄúPeople think that addiction is like, ‚ÄòOh, you were an addict,'‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúPeople don‚Äôt recognize it as a disease.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou think addiction is a choice, and it's not,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúI think that if there was less stigma around it, more people would speak up.‚Äù

She added that addiction has now "crossed over all sorts of socioeconomic boundaries ... it's everywhere."

‚ÄúMy husband was the furthest thing from a rock star junkie. He just wasn't," she said. "He was the best husband, the greatest father. I lost my soulmate and the love of my life.‚Äù

In the era of misinformation, there is a need for distinction between factual and fabricated news, and news that may be biased or incomplete. It has been reported that Kevin Bacon expressed support for President Trump in an interview with ABC's "This Week With George Stephanopoulos." However, this claim is not accurate.

A recent article on the fake news website Worldwide Politics purported to summarize a supposed interview with Kevin Bacon on "This Week." In this supposed interview, Bacon reportedly stated, "I honestly think that we are blessed to have him as President ‚Äì he is the only one who can take care of all this mess." However, Kevin Bacon has not appeared on "This Week" since 2007 and did not express support for President Trump during that time.

Kevin Bacon's political history does not suggest that he would have publicly endorsed President Trump. In 2007, he campaigned for John Edwards and later donated to Barack Obama. While some Obama voters may have shifted to Trump in 2016, there is little evidence to suggest that Kevin Bacon did so himself.

It is worth noting that Worldwide Politics is not the only fake news site that spreads false celebrity news. The Daily News for Americans also published a made-up story claiming that actress Julia Roberts called President Trump "the best president in US history" during the Women's March in Washington, D.C.

In conclusion, it is important to be cautious of news that may be false or biased. In this case, the Kevin Bacon story appears to be a product of misinformation and should be treated as such.

Bono, the lead singer of the iconic rock band U2, has revealed that he came close to death during the making of their latest album, "Songs of Experience." The 57-year-old musician opens up about the near-death experience in an interview with Rolling Stone magazine, revealing that it played a significant role in shaping the themes of the album.

"This political apocalypse was going on in Europe and in America, and it found a perfect rhyme with what was going on in my own life," Bono says. "And I have had a hail of blows over the years. You get warning signs, and then you realize that you are not a tank, as (my wife) Ali says. Edge has this thing that he says about me, that I look upon my body as an inconvenience."

While he does not want to discuss the details of his near-death experience, Bono acknowledges that it was a physical event that had a profound impact on him. "It's just a thing that ... people have these extinction events in their lives; it could be psychological or it could be physical," he says. "And, yes, it was physical for me, but I think I have spared myself all that soap opera."

Bono also reveals that his health scare was not the first time he has faced a life-threatening situation. In 2000, doctors wanted to biopsy him for throat cancer, but luckily everything turned out to be fine. He also broke his arm in a bicycle accident in 2014, which he calls a "comic tragedy."

Despite these close calls, Bono says that he has learned to keep some aspects of his life private. "Especially with this kind of celebrity obsession with the minutiae of peoples' lives ‚Äì I have got out of that," he says. "I want to speak about the issue in a way that lets people fill in the blanks of what they have been through, you know? It's one thing if you were talking about it in a place of record like Rolling Stone, but by the time it gets to your local tabloid it is just awful. It becomes the question that everyone is asking."

Ultimately, Bono says that his near-death experience has made him more aware of his own mortality and has inspired him to write about it in his music. "Strangely enough, mortality was going to be a subject anyway just because it is a subject not often covered," he says. "And you can't write 'Songs of Experience' without writing about that. And I've had a couple of these shocks to the system, let's call them, in my life. Like my bike accident or my back injury. So it was always going to be the subject. I just didn't want to be such an expert in it."

"ACTOR WILL FERRELL IN CRITICAL CONDITION AFTER HEAD-ON COLLISION ON CALIFORNIA HIGHWAY

While there is a large sum of money involved in the marriage, the Queen holds the majority of the royal property and fortune, estimated to be worth around $500 million, compared to Prince Harry's estimated $25 to $40 million. Meghan also has her own wealth as an actress on Suits, reportedly making around $50,000 per episode.

If Meghan and Harry divorce, negotiations would likely take place outside of court, as is the case with Diana's divorce. Although prenups are taken into account in U.K. divorces, they are not legally enforceable.

Royal splits have tried to make as few waves as possible in modern times, with the divorce described as amicable for PR reasons. The person departing the royal family would be looked after, and arrangements would be made behind closed doors, avoiding court proceedings.

The world has lost an extraordinary talent and a kind-hearted soul. Actor Reg E. Cathey, known for his exceptional performances in "House of Cards" and "The Wire," has passed away at the age of 59.

The news was announced by David Simon, the creator of "The Wire," who paid a heartfelt tribute to the late actor on Twitter. "Not only a fine, masterful actor ‚Äì but simply one of the most delightful human beings with whom I ever shared some long days on set," Simon wrote. "On wit alone, he could double any man over and leave him thinking. Reg, your memory is a great blessing."

Born in Huntsville, Alabama, in 1958, Reg Cathey was raised in a military family and developed an interest in theater at the age of 9. He attended the University of Michigan and the Yale School of Drama, where he honed his craft. James, 33, says in the beginning of the video, "I've been dreaming about this day for as long as I can remember. My parents have done so much for my siblings and I, and I am forever indebted to them. They've made so many sacrifices throughout their 33 years of marriage just to see us happy."

The star detailed all the extra work his immigrant parents put into raising their kids, which included both parents working two jobs. His mother worked as a housekeeper at Disney and an overnight cashier at Walgreens, while his father worked in maintenance and as a cashier at Burger King at night.

"Growing up I never needed anything, I had presents under the tree, food on the table, and a roof over my head," James says. "They did such a marvelous job of raising us, without us ever knowing their daily struggles."

In the tear-jerking moment, James' parents are seen walking into their new home, completely unaware that their son had secretly worked tirelessly to make their dream of owning a home a reality.

The video has been shared by thousands of people on social media, with many commenting on how touched they are by James' heart-felt gesture.

In a recent interview with Closer Weekly, Betty White, the iconic actress and star of the hit '80s sitcom The Golden Girls, revealed that she has no plans to retire. The 96-year-old actress, who began her television career in 1939, stated that she will continue working "forever."

Steven J. Boettcher, who co-directed the new PBS documentary about White's life, Betty White: First Lady of Television, exclusively told Closer Weekly that White is far from ready to retire and still "loves working!" Boettcher attributed White's success to her kind nature, explaining that she never said a bad word about anyone during the production of the documentary.

White, who is the subject of the upcoming PBS documentary, has been acting since she was in her early 20s and has been honoured with six Emmys throughout her career. She previously told Parade magazine that she takes nothing for granted and is very humbled by her success.

During her career, White was a regular guest on the hit game show Password from 1961 until 1975 and met the love of her life, host Allen Ludden, on the show. They were married from 1963 until Ludden's death in 1981 from cancer.

White never remarried and remained a proud stepmother to Ludden's three children from his first marriage. She was the first woman to produce a national TV show, the first woman to star in a sitcom, the first producer to hire a female director, and the first woman to receive an Emmy nomination.

Boettcher's new PBS documentary about White's life and illustrious career, Betty White: First Lady of Television, is set to premiere on Tuesday, Aug. 21.

LAS VEGAS, NV - America's late night comedians were in mourning following the deadliest mass shooting in US history, as they called for action on gun control to end the violence plaguing the country.

Jimmy Kimmel, tears streaming down his face, lamented the tragedy in his hometown, stating that "when someone with a beard attacks us we tap phones, we invoke travel bans, we build walls, we take every possible precaution to make sure it doesn't happen again." However, when an American buys a gun and kills other Americans, there is nothing that can be done, he said.

Stephen Colbert echoed President Trump's words, calling the mass shooting an "act of pure evil" and demanding that the US take action to combat "pure evil." He added that Congress could be heroes by doing anything on gun control, anything but "doing nothing."

Conan O'Brien reflected on the normalization of mass shootings, stating that when he started doing the job 24 years ago, mass shootings were extremely rare. He noted that during the past decade, things had changed, and it should not be "so easy for one demented person to kills so many people so quickly."

James Corden, an Englishman who has lived in the US for just over two and a half years, noted that the killings in Las Vegas were the second time in 21/2 years that the record for mass shooting deaths had been broken. He questioned how it was that every other developed country did a better job of preventing mass shootings, given the widespread availability of guns.

"Maybe the time for the thoughts and prayers of Congress members and the president has passed," Corden said. "We need to look to them to actually do something to prevent this from happening in the future."

Despite the somber mood, Corden also noted that even in these "strange times," they had a show to do, hoping to bring some levity to the most heavy of days.

The meteoric rise of Donald Trump and his seemingly unbeatable political prowess have left many experts stumped, seeking an explanation as to how this occurred. To fully understand this phenomenon, we must not only examine Trump himself, but also his devoted supporters, whose unwavering admiration and devotion to their unpredictable and often inflammatory leader baffles many.

Psychologists and neuroscientists have provided numerous thought-provoking explanations for Trump's enduring support, but the accounts of these experts often vary greatly, sometimes overlapping and other times conflicting. However insightful these critiques may be, it is clear that further research and examination are needed to pinpoint the exact psychological and social factors driving this bizarre behavior.

In a recent review paper published in the Journal of Social and Political Psychology, UC Santa Cruz professor Thomas Pettigrew argues that five major psychological phenomena can help explain this exceptional political event.

1. Authoritarianism: This refers to the advocacy or enforcement of strict obedience to authority, often at the expense of personal freedom. Those with authoritarian personality syndrome, a prevalent condition, often display aggression toward outgroup members, submissiveness to authority, resistance to new experiences, and a rigid hierarchical view of society. Trump's speeches, with their absolutist terms like "losers" and "disasters," naturally appeal to those who prefer authoritarianism. Research has shown that Republican voters scored higher on measures of authoritarianism before Trump's rise, and a 2016 survey found that high authoritarians greatly favored Trump, leading to his election win.

2. Social dominance orientation (SDO): This refers to people who prefer a societal hierarchy where high-status groups have dominance over low-status ones. Those with SDO are typically dominant, tough-minded, and driven by self-interest. Trump appeals to those with SDO by making clear distinctions between high-status groups (White) and low-status groups (immigrants and minorities). A survey found that those who scored high on both SDO and authoritarianism were those who intended to vote for Trump.

3. Prejudice: While not all Trump supporters are prejudiced against ethnic and religious minorities, some certainly are. The Republican party has long used strategies that appeal to bigotry, such as "dog whistles" that signal prejudice to racists but not to others. Trump's shockingly direct appeals to bigoted supporters, such as calling Muslims "dangerous" and Mexican immigrants "rapists" and "murderers," likely play a role in his popularity. A new study shows that support for Trump is correlated with a standard scale of modern racism.

4. Intergroup contact: Contact with members of groups outside one's own has been shown to reduce prejudice. However, Trump's white supporters have experienced significantly less contact with minorities than other Americans. A study found that the racial and ethnic isolation of Whites at the zip-code level is one of the strongest predictors of Trump support, and this correlation persisted while controlling for dozens of other variables. Support for Trump increased with voters' physical distance from the Mexican border.

5. Relative deprivation: This refers to the experience of feeling deprived of something one believes they are entitled to. Trump supporters who feel that American jobs are being lost to Mexico and China may be experiencing relative deprivation, particularly in swing states like Ohio, Michigan, and Pennsylvania. This kind of deprivation is based on a skewed perception of entitlement, rather than an absolute lack of resources.

These psychological phenomena help explain the peculiar behavior of Trump's supporters, but further research is needed to fully understand this phenomenon.

Roseanne Barr has been hit with a wave of backlash after she blamed her controversial racist tweet on Ambien, the insomnia medication she was taking. The actress and comedian, who was recently fired from her ABC show and talent agency, claimed that she was under the influence of the medication when she made the tweet that sparked outrage.

Barr first made the excuse in a series of tweets on Tuesday, saying that she was "ambien tweeting" at 2am and that she had done "weird stuff while on ambien - cracked eggs on the wall at 2am etc." She later added, "guys I did something unforgiveable so do not defend me."

But her excuse didn't sit well with people, who pointed out that she had previously tweeted racist things and that she had been fired from her show for making a racist tweet. Late-night hosts latched onto her excuse, joking that racism might be a side effect of Ambien in spoof ads.

The manufacturer of Ambien, Sanofi U.S., responded to the comments, saying that racism is not a known side effect of any Sanofi medication.

On Comedy Central, The Daily Show host Trevor Noah joked, "If you listen to their ads, there is a subtle warning about just [racism]."

In related news, Roseanne Barr has been fired from her ABC show and talent agency after she made a racist tweet. The tweet caused a firestorm and led to her being fired from the show and the talent agency.

Barr's excuse for her racist tweet has been met with widespread criticism, and she has been called out for her previous racist tweets. It's unclear if she will be able to return to the show or the talent agency.

In a statement, ABC said, "Roseanne Barr's tweets about race are reprehensible and have no place on our air or anywhere else. We have terminated our agreement with her."

Trevor Noah joked on his show that if Ambien is taken on Memorial Day, racist side effects are amplified. He also pointed out that if you've ever asked when there will be a White History Month, used the phrase "I'm not racist, but..." or previously tweeted racist things that your boss forgot about, then Ambien might be for you.

On Full Frontal, a fake ad for the drug showed images of individuals struggling to fall asleep with a voiceover narration stating, "If sleeping through the night feels like a far away dream, try Ambien, the prescription sleep aid that helps you get a good night's sleep and possibly makes you racist?"

The ad goes on to state that users should use Ambien if "you've ever asked when will there be a White History Month," used the phrase "I'm not racist, but..." and "if you've previously tweeted racist things that your boss forgot about." The latter statement was accompanied by an old tweet by Barr.

Overall, the backlash against Barr's racist tweet and her excuse for it has been swift and severe. It's unclear if she will be able to return to the show or the talent agency, and she has been called out for her previous racist tweets.

On August 11th, a judge dismissed a lawsuit filed by David Mueller against Taylor Swift. The lawsuit was filed by Mueller, who claimed that the singer got him fired from his job at 98.5 KYGO after Mueller groped her at a concert in 2013. The judge ruled that Swift could not be held liable for Mueller's firing because he failed to prove that she personally set out to have him fired. Mueller's similar allegations against Swift's mother, Andrea Swift, and her radio liaison, Frank Bell, will go to a jury for a verdict, with closing statements set for Monday. Swift's case against Mueller for assault and battery is still going forward. Swift, who is countersuing Mueller for $1, took the stand on Thursday to detail the incident. Mueller's attorney noted that Swift could have taken a break following the alleged incident. Swift's former bodyguard, Greg Dent, also took the stand on Friday and testified that he saw Mueller's hand under Swift's skirt. Swift's countersuit against the DJ will also go before a jury next week with closing arguments set to begin on Monday morning.

A judge in the ongoing divorce case between Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt has expressed concerns about the children's lack of relationship with their father. The judge emphasized the importance of maintaining a healthy and strong relationship between the children and their parents, stating that "not having a relationship with their father is harmful to them." The judge has also ordered Jolie to provide her children with cellphones that allow Pitt to call them at any time, without Jolie monitoring, and to refrain from reading their text messages with their father.

The court has outlined a summer schedule for the children, except for Maddox, who is old enough to decide how much time he wants to spend with Pitt. Pitt will have custody of the children from June 8 to June 17, for four hours per day, while he stays in London, where Jolie is renting a house. He will designate one or two minor children to spend time with at a time and will also spend time with each child at least twice during this 10-day period. Jolie will not be present during or interfere with Pitt's custodial time.

Pitt will also have custody of the children from July 8 to July 14, when a doctor will be required to be present and will meet with the children before and after each two-day period. From July 21 to July 29, Pitt will resume custody of the children when he returns to California. The court noted that if the minor children remain closed off to their father, it may result in a reduction of the time they spend with Jolie and may lead to primary physical custody being ordered in Pitt's favor.

Jolie's spokesperson has expressed disappointment at the release of confidential court records, stating that it is not in the best interests of the children. The spokesperson emphasized that Jolie has been focused on the children's health and needs throughout the divorce.

According to a source, Brad is eager to introduce Oxman to his six children at an appropriate time. However, it is important to note that Pitt and Jolie made a pact to not date anyone until their divorce was officially settled. Oxman is said to be very respectful of Jolie and will not rub their new relationship in her face.

The Sun reports that the idea of "upgrading" with each relationship is an interesting concept, but it remains to be seen whether Oxman is an upgrade from Jolie or if Pitt's wish list of demands will continue to grow. As for Jolie, she is currently in England with her children and is not dating anyone. It is unclear when Pitt will see his children or introduce Oxman to them.

A recent report by In Touch claims that actor Brad Pitt has gained custody of his children following their divorce from Angelina Jolie. According to the source, Brad is overjoyed at the prospect of spending more time with his six children, who will be staying in Los Angeles while Angelina films Maleficent 2 in Britain.

The source also claims that Brad was initially opposed to Angelina's decision to move the children to London, but she convinced him that he would be able to spend longer periods with them if he agreed to the move. The source adds that Brad is already preparing his Los Angeles home and has been sprucing up the pool area, skateboard ramp, and bike track to make it more appealing to his children.

The report suggests that Brad is hoping that spending time with his children over the summer will give him the leverage he needs to finally secure joint custody. The source notes that Brad has been patient for a long time and that something has to give, as Angelina cannot control everything forever. However, neither Brad nor Angelina have responded to In Touch's report.

Madonna, the iconic pop star, has recently spoken publicly about her experience as a single mother to four children, highlighting the challenges she faces in balancing her career and family life. At 56, she remains committed to her music career while also raising her four children, including Lourdes, Rocco, Mercy, and David Banda, aged 18, 13, 9, and 9, respectively. Despite her success, Madonna remains humble and devoted to her family, showing that even the most famous mothers face the same struggles as any other parent. She has also been vocal about her opinions on sensitive topics such as adoption and drug use, further demonstrating her strength and resilience as a mother.

In 1986, I stepped into the world of Hollywood as a 11-year-old awkward, geeky, and prominent-nosed Jewish kid. Back then, we didn't have social media, reality TV, or the internet, but I quickly realized that I didn't fit the mold of the industry's beauty standards. Women in the industry were valued based on their physical appearance and sex appeal, and it was a harsh reality that I had to accept.

The Harvey Weinstein scandal serves as a harsh reminder of the exploitative nature of the industry. It's no surprise that a man with such a reputation for sexual assault would abuse his power, but it's a disturbing reflection on the systemic problem that exists in the industry. Women are objectified and valued based on their appearance, and it's time for change.

"Get ready for Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again, because Amanda Seyfried just killed it on The Tonight Show! The actress promoted the upcoming sequel to the ABBA-inspired musical, and of course, Jimmy Fallon had to test her skills with his Google Translate Song Challenge.

The results were hilarious! Seyfried sang an all-new version of "Dancing Queen" called "Hula Prince" that left the audience in stitches with its twist ending. Fallon then transformed "Take A Chance On Me" into "Steal My Sad Clocks," and closed out the challenge with a duet of the movie's title song, "Mamma Mia!", which translated to "My Mom Arrived!"

Check out the full video of Seyfried's hilarious performance of "Hula Prince" below and get ready for Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again this weekend!"

"Starboy" Singer Donates $100,000 to East Africa Medical Facility in Record Time!

The Weeknd has made a sensational donation of $100,000 to the Suubi Health Center, a maternity and children's medical facility located in Budondo, Uganda. The donation was motivated by French Montana's efforts to raise awareness for the health center through Global Citizen, a social action platform, and Mama Hope.

Montana's #Unforgettable Dance Challenge, which was launched to raise funds for the center, has been gaining traction and has inspired other musicians to join in on the cause. The Moroccan rapper has been spreading the word through his music video, which has been deemed a "call to action" to raise awareness for the needs of Suubi and the people of Uganda.

In March, Montana traveled to Uganda to shoot the "Unforgettable" music video and met with the founders of the Suubi Center. He was so inspired by the visit that he pledged the first $100,000 donation to help pay for ambulances, premature incubators, cribs, and a blood bank for the Suubi community.

This is just the beginning of The Weeknd's efforts to make a difference in the world. The singer is challenging others, including some of his musical peers, to join him in making donations to help pay for the new maternity center.

Click here for more information on Montana's #Unforgettable Dance challenge and how you can get involved.

There have been rumors that Angelina Jolie is considering adopting another child, but a source close to Brad Pitt has exclusively revealed his reaction to these rumors. According to the source, Brad has no desire to adopt any more children at this point in his life. He has a full plate caring for his existing children and does not feel the need to expand his family further.

When it comes to the rumors that Angelina may be looking to adopt again, Brad is neither surprised nor cares. He knows that Angelina has always discussed the possibility of adopting more children with him, but he has no interest in competing with her in an adoption war or trying to keep up with her in that way.

All Brad cares about now is ensuring that he is providing the best possible care for his own children. He wants to give them the attention and love they deserve, and does not feel the need to add to his family.

According to a recent report, Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie have agreed to spend Christmas together with their six children, despite their previous divorce. The couple will reportedly celebrate the holiday together for the sake of their children, Maddox, Pax, Zahara, Shiloh, Vivienne, and Knox. A source told OK! Magazine that the couple will not be getting back together, but will still be able to celebrate as a family. The source also said that Brad enjoys spoiling his children and that Angie has softened to the idea of him playing Santa on Christmas morning. Additionally, Brad's production company Plan B will reportedly support Angie's movie First They Killed My Father. The source concluded that Brad and Angie still care about each other and want to be kind during the holiday season, which is a time for new beginnings.

Kendall Jenner, the stunning model and highest earning model in the world, channels her passion for boxing and modelling in the latest LOVE Magazine advent calendar. In the series of images, Kendall strips down to a matching sweatpants and crop top, and takes on the role of iconic fighter Rocky Balboa. Despite the gruelling workout, Kendall looks fierce and stunning, proving that boxing is not just an exercise, but a way of embracing a strong self and having fun. Inside the Kardashian's property empire and who owns what.

According to newly released federal tax filings, Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie donated more than $8 million in 2006, with Pitt contributing $4,402,317 and Jolie donating $4,123,613. The couple's foundation distributed $2,367,935 to various charitable organizations in 2006, including $1 million to Doctors Without Borders (International Division) and Global Action for Children. Other donations included $137,935 to the Namibia Red Cross Action Program, $100,000 to the Daniel Pearl Foundation and Global Green U.S.A., and $20,000 to an art park in Los Angeles. Pitt's costar in the movie Wanted, Morgan Freeman, praised Jolie for her efforts in New Orleans, calling her "such a wonderful woman."

Jennifer Hudson left the Grammy Awards in awe as Ellen DeGeneres surprised her with her second trophy of the night! The stunning singer was given the Best Musical Theater album award for her performance in Broadway's The Color Purple, but was unable to attend the ceremony. That's when the talk show host stepped in and delivered the trophy personally to Jennifer during a heartfelt chat on Ellen's talk show. The actress was visibly moved and shocked by Ellen's generous gesture. "Oh my God! Thank you!" she exclaimed. Jennifer also gave a brief acceptance speech, noting that her first Grammy was given to her by the late Whitney Houston and her second by Ellen. Jennifer, along with the rest of The Color Purple's cast, won the award in the Best Musical Theater album category. Jennifer portrayed the role of nightclub performer Shug Avery in the musical last year, but was later replaced by Heather Headley.

On January 27, 2017, the tabloid magazine Star claimed that the actor Joshua Jackson had been secretly dating January Jones since his breakup with his girlfriend Diane Kruger in July. However, a representative for Jones denied the allegations, stating that the claim was not true.

There have been rumors that Kylie Jenner will receive a $50,000 coupon for plastic surgery from her mother, Caitlyn Jenner, as a push present after giving birth. However, a representative for Caitlyn has denied these rumors.

Kylie, who is 20 years old and expecting her first child, has been keeping her baby bump hidden during her pregnancy. She has starred in a Calvin Klein ad campaign with her sisters, including Khloe Kardashian, who is already pregnant. While Kardashian showed off her pregnant belly, Jenner managed to keep her stomach hidden with strategic placement of props and blankets.

Jenner has been having trouble accepting her changing body, as she is insecure about not being as curvy or pretty as her sisters. The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star has been keeping her pregnancy private and has not publicly revealed much about her changing body.

Speculations are circulating that Nicole Kidman and her husband Keith Urban are attempting to have one last baby, with the actress being spotted tenderly touching her stomach and turning down alcohol during the Golden Globes. Beyonce has once again sparked pregnancy rumors after stepping out in a revealing gown in France. The singer, accompanied by her daughter Blue Ivy and husband Jay-Z, was seen in a long, stomach-covering gown with a low-cut neckline and a revealing cleavage. While some fans speculate that the dress may have been strategically designed to hide a baby bump, others point out that Beyonce has performed while pregnant before, so it's possible that she is not actually with child.

The rumors began after Beyonce appeared to give a subtle hint that she was pregnant during a concert stop on her On The Run II tour in Rome on July 8. In fan footage from the concert, she can be seen briefly rubbing her stomach. This gesture led some fans to speculate that she was pregnant, and she confirmed the news at the 2011 VMAs, where she revealed that she was pregnant with daughter Blue Ivy.

Beyonce and Jay-Z have a history of naming their albums after the number four, with Beyonce releasing 4 in 2011 and Jay-Z releasing 4:44 in 2017. It's possible that they may choose to name their fourth child after this number, adding to the rumors that a fourth child is on the way for the Carters.

While Beyonce's appearance may be causing some to speculate about a possible baby bump, it's important to remember that appearances can be deceiving and that only time will tell if she is actually pregnant.

EXCLUSIVE: The Walking Dead Fans Reel as Carl Grimes' Fate is Revealed in Shocking Mid-Season Finale!

In a heart-wrenching turn of events, The Walking Dead stunned viewers with its latest episode, titled "How It's Gonna Be." The episode revealed that Carl Grimes, the beloved character played by Chandler Riggs, had been bitten by a walker, leaving his fate uncertain.

As Carl and Rick Grimes (portrayed by Andrew Lincoln) arrived to bomb Alexandria, Carl made a bold move, offering himself up as a sacrifice to Negan (portrayed by Jeffrey Dean Morgan). "If you have to kill someone, if there have to be punishments, then kill me," Carl said. "I'm serious."

Carl's decision left fans in tears, with one distraught fan tweeting, "ARE YOU SERIOUSLY KIDDING ME...OH MY GOD I AM SITTING IN A PUDDLE OF TEARS RIGHT NOT WHY DOES TWD ALWAYS DO THIS TO ME #TheWalkingDead." Another fan wrote, "If you need me I'll be crying over Carl #TWD #TheWalkingDead."

However, not everyone was convinced that Carl's death was inevitable. One hopeful fan wrote, "I'm not fully convinced that Carl is going to die. I don't know how, but I feel like he's going to live. #TheWalkingDead."

As fans await the show's return next year, rumors are swirling about Carl's fate. Will his death be played out in the first episode of the new season? Only time will tell.

Actor Brad Pitt has been balancing his work on his new film, Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, with spending time with his children. According to a source, the 54-year-old has been spending time with his six children with estranged wife Angelina Jolie at his Los Feliz, California, home. The source also revealed that there is "a lot of laughter and skating" around the house.

Last month, Pitt and Jolie struck a new custody agreement, which allows Pitt to spend more time with his children over the summer. According to court documents obtained by ET, Jolie is required to help repair her children's relationship with Pitt. The judge determined that the children "not having a relationship with their father is harmful to them," and Pitt will now have more time with his minor children -- Pax, Zahara, Shiloh, and Knox and Vivienne -- while Maddox can determine how much time he wants to spend with his father.

In keeping with the new custody agreement, Pitt has been with the children since July 21 and will have them through July 29, before he is responsible for getting the kids back to London to be with Jolie. Pitt must arrange for visits with doctors and a therapist during his time with the kids, while Jolie is only allowed to call the kids once per day at a time agreed in advance by both parents.

A source previously told ET that Pitt is focusing on co-parenting and fatherhood over dating. "Brad was taking time to date, when he had the time," the source said. "But now all he wants to do is focus on family." The source also added that Pitt and Jolie "still don't get along at all" and "can barely be in the same room."

Blake Shelton, who will turn 41 on June 18, is preparing to celebrate his birthday with his partner, Gwen Stefani. However, Gwen is experiencing mixed emotions about the upcoming event. A source close to the couple exclusively told HollywoodLife.com that Gwen is feeling conflicted because her birthday falls on Father's Day.

The source explained that Father's Day reminds Gwen of her ex-husband, Gavin Rossdale, and she still aches thinking about their children. However, she also realizes that Blake is now becoming a stepfather to her children and that reminds her of the family she is building with Blake. Despite her mixed emotions, Gwen wants to celebrate Blake's birthday, but she also has to think about Gavin that day.

Blake, on the other hand, is taking things as they come and is putting Gwen at ease by telling her that all they have to do is be together, and he will be there for her regardless of what emotions she has on that day. He respects Gavin as the father of her children and knows that he will always be a part of their lives, so he is okay with Gwen's feelings and will do his best to make her not worry about it as much.

Fans were left heartbroken as the This Is Us finale "Moonshadow" aired, as they believed they were about to discover the fate of beloved Pearson family patriarch Jack Pearson. However, the devastating truth was revealed to be something entirely different.

In a poignant storyline, we were given a glimpse into two defining moments in Jack's life: the day he met his wife Rebecca and the day he irreparably damaged their relationship. The first revealed Jack to be a hardworking handyman and mechanic, saving money and dreaming of a better future. He finally won a large poker game, but was robbed and assaulted by his competitors. In a fit of rage, Jack decides to plot his revenge by stealing money from the cash register of the men who attacked him. Instead, he falls in love with Rebecca, a love that would ultimately lead to heartbreak.

In the second, heart-wrenching storyline, Jack is devastated by his wife's decision to go on tour for weeks on end. He is so angry and hurt that he gets drunk on his way to her performance and continues to drink even when he arrives. As viewers know, Jack has struggled with alcoholism, a struggle that he tried to overcome when his children were young.

Despite his drunken behavior, Jack finds himself kicked out of Rebecca's performance and forced to drive home. When they arrive, Rebecca demands to know what Jack loves about her in that moment, not in the past. In a heart-wrenching moment, Jack professes his love for her as a mother, as a woman who is still beautiful, who still makes him laugh, who still dances with all his heart, and who is still the same woman who ran out of a blind date all those years ago because she had to sing.

However, even with this passionate declaration of love, Jack leaves the Pearson household as a symbol of his penance for his terrible behavior, leaving his wife and children heartbroken in his wake.

The final season of Game of Thrones is going to be a bittersweet moment for all of us. We have been waiting for this for years, and now it's finally here. The season 7 finale aired on August 27, 2017, and we've been eagerly waiting for the next chapter.

Thrones' Season 7 finale was one of the most emotional episodes in the series, and we know that the eighth season will be no exception. We have seen the characters grow and change over the years, and we have been through their ups and downs with them.

The final season of Game of Thrones will be a farewell to an era of television, and we all know that it's going to be bittersweet. We will miss the characters, the storylines, and the world that George R.R. Martin has created. But we also know that the final season will be worth the wait.

So mark your calendars, fans. The eighth and final season of Game of Thrones will arrive in April of 2019, and we can't wait.

Time magazine has clarified that it has not named Donald Trump as its Person of the Year for 2017. The magazine's decision to name a Person of the Year is based on a careful consideration of events and figures that have had a significant impact on the world during the previous year.

Donald Trump has a long history with Time magazine, having been named its Person of the Year in 2016. He was less than impressed with the magazine's decision, and criticized it on several occasions after being named Person of the Year.

It is not uncommon for people to speculate about who will be named Time's Person of the Year, and Mr. Trump's claim that he was "probably" going to take out the title when it is announced on December 6 has predictably been a source of mirth on social media.

Despite the magazine's clarification, Mr. Trump's tweet has once again put his relationship with Time magazine in the spotlight. It is unclear whether Mr. Trump will be named Person of the Year for a second time, or whether he will continue to be critical of the magazine's choice.

As the 75th Golden Globe Awards grace us with their presence this weekend, the anticipation is palpable. Hollywood's least serious award show is set to kick off the awards season, and while it may not hold the same weight as the Oscars, it often foreshadows the direction that the industry is heading in. Hosting the show this year is none other than Seth Meyers, who you may recognize from his NBC late-night show, "Late Night with Seth Meyers."

This will be Meyers' first time hosting the Golden Globes, but he's not exactly a stranger to talk show hosting. He'll be following in the footsteps of Jimmy Fallon, who hosted last year. NBC is marketing the show under the tagline "Hollywood, we have a lot to talk about," so expect lots of humor and not-at-all uncomfortable and awkward moments about the recent turmoil in Hollywood over sexual harassment and abuse.

Meyers spoke with The Hollywood Reporter about taking on the gig, revealing that he discussed it with his wife and women on his writing staff. He saw it as an opportunity to "say some things that you wouldn't be able to say in previous years."

On the film side of things, The Shape of Water leads with seven nominations, followed closely by The Post and Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, both with six nods. Lady Bird is also up for several big awards, although not for Best Director, which once again overlooked all female directors.

The TV awards are more widely distributed, with HBO's Big Little Lies leading with six nominations, but it's up against a slate of other prominent prestige shows, including The Handmaid's Tale, This Is Us, Master of None, Stranger Things, and The Crown.

The ceremony will begin at 5PM PT / 8PM ET on Sunday, January 7th, and will take place at The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, California. The show will be broadcast live on NBC, as it has been since 1993. If you're in need of some extra glamour, you can tune in an hour earlier for the red carpet arrivals, which will be streamed exclusively on Facebook.

So how do you watch? If you have NBC, you can watch through an over-the-air antenna, cable, or satellite. If not, fear not! This year, NBC and the Hollywood Foreign Press Association have reached a deal to allow for online streaming of the awards show. Simply head to NBC's app or website, or check your cable or satellite provider for online access. And if you're not a subscriber, most of these services offer free seven-day trials, so you can give it a shot without committing to a long-term subscription.

Twitter will also be a great resource for following along with reactions and memes in real time, and The Verge will be reporting live on the night, with a running list of winners, reactions, and other news. So gather around the TV, gather round the internet, and let's celebrate Hollywood's finest.

Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, announced his resignation on Friday, citing personal reasons. He will continue to serve the administration until August.

Vice President Mike Pence expressed his respect for Spicer's decision to step down and wished him well in his future endeavors. Anthony Scaramucci, the new White House communications director, praised Spicer's service and noted that he was a "military serviceman" with a "great family."

Some lawmakers and celebrities took to Twitter to comment on Spicer's resignation. California Rep. Maxine Waters, a vocal critic of the Trump administration, congratulated Spicer and praised his "guts." Comedians also weighed in on the news, with Jimmy Kimmel encouraging Spicer to write a book.

While some expressed sympathy with Spicer, others noted that his departure from the White House would mean that actress Melissa McCarthy would no longer have the opportunity to parody him on "Saturday Night Live." Some also suggested potential replacements for Spicer's role.

Overall, Spicer's resignation has been met with a mix of reactions, with some praising his service and others criticizing his time in the White House.

R. KELLY UNVEILS 19-MINUTE SONG ADMITTING TO SEXUAL ABUSE CLAIMS AND TROUBLES IN LIFE!

In a shocking move, R. Kelly has released a new 19-minute song, "I Admit," addressing the sexual abuse claims against him and revealing the personal troubles that have plagued him throughout his career.

The embattled entertainer, whose real name is Robert Sylvester Kelly, has long been accused of behavior that has ranged from questionable to criminal. He was accused of child pornography after a widely circulated videotape appeared to show him having sex with, and urinating on, a teenage girl. He was acquitted of all charges in 2008 and continued to rack up hits and sell out stadiums around the country.

On "I Admit," Kelly sings that he's "not convicted, not arrested, dragged my name in the dirt/All this work to be successful, when you abandon me 'cause of what you heard." The song also reveals that he was sexually abused as a child, with the lyrics, "a family member touched me" and revealing he was "so scared to say something, so I just put the blame on me."

Kelly is one of pop music's best-selling artists and his hits include "Ignition," ''I Believe I Can Fly," ''Step in the Name of Love" and "Bump N' Grind." He has also written hits for artists ranging from Celine Dion to Michael Jackson to Lady Gaga. While he's written classic love songs and even gospel music, he is defined by sexually explicit songs such as "Feelin' on Yo Booty," ''Your Body's Calling Me," ''Sex Me" and even more explicit fare.

On the new song, he says he was sexually abused as a child, singing "a family member touched me" and revealing he was "so scared to say something, so I just put the blame on me."

I would never use that to defend this behavior."

In conjunction to the #MeToo movement, Viola Davis, Shonda Rhimes and Ava DuVernay and other celebrities participated in the Time's Up movement's #MuteRKelly social media campaign in April, calling for a boycott of his music and performances.

Kelly's concert in his hometown of Chicago was canceled around the time the Times' Up campaign took aim at the singer over allegations he sexually abused women. Weeks later, Spotify removed his music from its playlists, citing its new policy on hate content and hateful conduct.

The song was not released on Sony's RCA Records, where Kelly is signed. The label said it had no comment about the song. Kelly posted a link to the song Monday with the caption: "Today is the day you've been waiting for."

At just 39 years old, Legend is not only the youngest EGOT recipient but also the first black man to land this prestigious title. He also played the role of Jesus in NBC's production of the 1970 concept album-turned-Broadway musical, and he's up for the Emmy for outstanding actor in a limited series or movie, which will be revealed at the big primetime Emmy Awards on Monday.

Gal Gadot, the Israeli actress who gained popularity with her performance in "Wonder Women," has announced her participation in Tzvi Fishman's new musical movie, "Queen Esther." The film, which tells the story of the Purim miracle, will be shot in Israel and in Hebrew, her native language.

She believes that a woman is more than just her appearance and that movies should recognize the depth in women. The film's producer, Fishman, reports that the budget was raised through a "half-shekel" fundraising campaign.

The cast includes Israel's popular actor Yehuda Barkan as Achashveros and former United States President Barack Obama as the wicked Haman. Lorde, a popular New Zealand pop-singer, is scheduled to play the role of Haman's wife, Vashti. Fishman himself will play the male lead, Esther's uncle, Mordechai the Jew.

Fishman, a religious Jew, has addressed concerns about the Torah prohibition of hearing the voice of a singing woman and the prohibition of gazing at women. He explained that all the voices of women will be computer generated and dubbed, and all the actresses will wear masks, in line with the tradition of wearing costumes on Purim.

Fishman, who was awarded the Israel Ministry of Education Prize for Jewish Culture and Creativity, hopes that the film will inspire Jews to recognize their true selves and return to Israel and Torah.

On Friday, Harvey Weinstein turned himself in to New York authorities on charges of rape, criminal sex act, sex abuse, and sexual misconduct in relation to two women. An attorney for Weinstein, who has previously denied allegations of non-consensual sex, confirmed that he would plead not guilty to all charges filed by Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. The investigation into Weinstein, which began after the New York Times and the New Yorker reported in October that dozens of women had accused the Hollywood producer of sexual harassment and assault, follows months of determined reporting and the #MeToo movement.

The allegations against Weinstein have been the subject of several civil suits, and this is the first time he has faced criminal charges. In October 2015, Vance Jr. declined to press charges after investigating whether Weinstein groped Italian model Ambra Battilana. Asia Argento, who has accused Weinstein of sexual assault, expressed hope for justice on Friday, stating, "We, the women, finally have real hope for justice."

While the New York charges are the first against Weinstein, several other cities have also launched investigations into the producer in the wake of the allegations. Federal prosecutors have opened a criminal investigation into Weinstein's alleged sex crimes, and the Los Angeles County District Attorney's office is reviewing five investigations. London's Metropolitan Police is also investigating Weinstein, although no charges have been filed against him in London as of Friday.

Police announced the arrests of two individuals in the murders of four women that occurred at the Fairmont Terrace Apartments last month. The brothers, James Stanford Poore, 32, and Cedric Dwayne Poore, 39, were each booked on four complaints of first degree murder.

On January 7, 2013, four women, Rebeika Powell and Kayetie Powell-Melchor, both 23, Misty Nunley, 33, and Julie Jackson, 55, were found shot in the head with their hands tied behind their backs inside a Tulsa apartment. A 3-year-old boy was also found unharmed in the apartment.

Witnesses reported that the brothers left the apartment in the same building and returned later with a bag full of drugs, cash, and jewelry. According to the report, James Poore told the witnesses that he shot one of the victims because she could identify him and that Cedric shot the other three.

Cedric Poore has been in jail on a traffic violation since January 14 and James Poore was arrested on Wednesday. Both have been previously convicted and incarcerated for robbery with a firearm.

Chief Chuck Jordan said the murders were not gang-related and that more arrests may still be made.

Mayor Dewey Bartlett released a statement expressing confidence in the police department's efforts and noting that the issue is bigger than crime and about poverty. The city is moving forward on a mission to hold out-of-state apartment owners accountable for safe and secure places to live.

On Sunday night, the Screen Actors Guild (SAG) Awards were held, honoring the outstanding performances in film and television. The ceremony, which was hosted by Kristen Bell, was broadcast live on TNT and TBS.

The winners of the evening included "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," "This Is Us," "Veep," and "Big Little Lies," which took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture. In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role category, Frances McDormand won for "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," while Saoirse Ronan took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role. In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series category, "This Is Us" was the winner.

In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series category, Elisabeth Moss took home the award for "The Handmaid's Tale," while Sterling K. Brown won for "This Is Us." In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series category, Jason Bateman won for "Ozark," while Peter Dinklage took home the award for "Game of Thrones." In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Television Movie or Miniseries category, Nicole Kidman won for "Big Little Lies," while Alexander Skarsgard took home the award for "Big Little Lies."

In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role category, Sam Rockwell won for "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," while Mary J. Blige took home the award for "Mudbound." In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role category, Allison Janney won for "I, Tonya," while Reese Witherspoon took home the award for "Big Little Lies." In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series category, "Veep" won, while "GLOW" took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series. In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Comedy Series category, William H. Macy won for "Shameless," while Julia Louis-Dreyfus took home the award for "Veep." In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Motion Picture category, "Wonder Woman" won.

The final episode of "Real Housewives of Atlanta" reunion aired on Sunday night, and it was a dramatic one. Kandi Burruss confronted Phaedra Parks about spreading a vicious rape rumor that had been plaguing the show all season.

Gaga vowed to be a voice for cancer patients and to honor Sonja's memory by being a "little stronger" every day. And I love so much her husband Andre, stepson Sante, and friends. I made them some food yesterday. I will keep cooking. Cooking my soul until it understands this."

Sonja's passing has left Gaga and many of her fans heartbroken, and the hashtag #RIPSonja trended on Twitter as fans sent their support and paid tribute to her friendship with Gaga. Rest in peace, Sonja Durham.

Alan Dawson, a combat sports correspondent for Insider, was abruptly whisked away to Las Vegas after being shortlisted for Sports Journalist of the Year in 2020. He has twice been recognized by the Boxing Writer's Association of America, serves as a Hall of Fame voter, and is a proud member of the MMA Journalists Association.

Since joining Insider in 2017 as a reporter, Alan has been promoted to senior reporter and then to a correspondent in 2020. He has dedicated his career to establishing Insider Inc. as one of the top independent publications in the fight sports industry, with millions of readers worldwide every month.

Alan's relentless pursuit of truth and justice has led him to investigate the nexus between organized crime and boxing, exposing possible bribery in sports. He has witnessed some of the most unforgettable moments in combat sports history, including Fury-Wilder 2, Khabib Nurmagomedov's retirement, and Davis-Garcia.

Alan's international reporting assignments have taken him to Europe, the Middle East, and across the United States. He was one of only a few credentialed journalists to cover the UFC during the pandemic era of sports, when the company held MMA events in a bubble environment on Yas Island, Abu Dhabi.

Alan's insightful and empathetic reporting has been featured on Morning Kombat on Showtime, BBC and GB News in the UK, and The Sun in Ireland. His work has been referenced by CNN, The Telegraph, Forbes, USA Today, IB Times, Boxing Scene, World Boxing News, Sherdog, Bloody Elbow, The Sun, The Mirror, and Metro, as well as national media in Finland, Ukraine, Russia, Indonesia, Singapore, and Vietnam.

As Alan continues to fight for the truth and expose the dark underbelly of combat sports, his dedication and passion have inspired millions around the world to stand with him. His courage and resilience serve as a beacon of hope in a world that often struggles to find it.

"Grey's Anatomy: The Medical Drama That Never Dies"

ABC has announced the official return of Grey's Anatomy for the 2018-19 broadcast season, making it the longest-running primetime drama in history and tying it with ER as the longest-running medical drama. With over 435 episodes, Grey's Anatomy has surpassed even The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet, which ran for 15 seasons and 435 episodes. Only seven dramas in the history of television have had more seasons than Grey's, including Gunsmoke, Law & Order, NCIS, CSI, and ER.

The renewal of Grey's Anatomy was made official at the wrap party for the Shonda Rhimes drama, where ABC Entertainment president Channing Dungey praised the show's loyal fans and the new generations of viewers who continue to discover the joy and drama of Grey Sloan Memorial.

The renewal of Grey's Anatomy was made possible thanks to a new two-year deal signed by star Ellen Pompeo, who remains the highest-earning actress on a drama series. The deal includes a seven-figure signing bonus, two full backend equity points on the show, and producing fees on both the flagship series and spinoff Station 19.

Grey's Anatomy has become increasingly important for ABC since creator Shonda Rhimes left her longtime home at ABC Studios for a nine-figure deal with Netflix. Rhimes has since handed off day-to-day control of the show to Krista Vernoff, who has helped creatively recharge the series and Pompeo.

The current 14th season ranks as ABC's No. 1 drama among the advertiser-coveted adults 18-49 demographic and No. 2 at the network among total viewers. With Pompeo, Justin Chambers, Chandra Wilson, and James Pickens Jr. all set to return for season 15, along with co-stars Kevin McKidd, Jesse Williams, Caterina Scorsone, Camilla Luddington, Kelly McCreary, Giacomo Gianniotti, Sarah Drew, and Jessica Capshaw, Grey's Anatomy is set to continue its reign as the longest-running primetime drama in history.

Grey's Anatomy joins a roster of ABC shows set to return for 2018-19, including comedies The Goldbergs, Modern Family, and Roseanne, as well as the previously renewed Good Doctor. Those join new pickups including the 1990s-set Goldbergs spinoff, Nathan Fillion drama The Rookie, and Take Two, with the latter likely set for this summer.

Kourtney Kardashian, a 38-year-old reality star, is known for her dedication to fitness and healthy eating. In a recent post on her website, she shared her "current meal plan," which emphasizes the importance of including organic whole foods in her diet.

On Tuesday, Queen Elizabeth II made a special visit to Kensington Palace to meet her new great-grandson, Prince Louis. The 92-year-old monarch arrived at the palace by helicopter and was seen dressed casually, wearing a scarf around her head and giving cameras a sly smile. It is presumed that she had a bouquet of flowers, which were likely a gift for new mom Kate Middleton.

The birth of Kate and Prince William's third child, Prince Louis, marks a significant moment for the royal family. Not only is he the queen's sixth great-grandchild, but he has also become the fifth in line to the throne, following his sister Princess Charlotte. The Succession to the Crown Act ensures that female heirs will have a guaranteed spot in line, regardless of whether they have male siblings born after them.

FX, Donald Glover, Stephen Glover, and Marvel Television have announced that they will no longer be working together on Marvel's Deadpool animated series. The project, which received a 10-episode straight-to-series order in May of last year, was set to premiere in 2018 on FX Networks' comedy-focused FXX.

In a statement, FX said that "creative differences" had led to the decision to part ways with the project. Sources say that Marvel did not agree with the Glovers' vision for the show, which was based on scripts written by Stephen Glover. Despite this, FX supported the brothers, who have overall deals at FX Prods.

The untitled Marvel's Deadpool series was to be produced by Marvel TV in association with FX Productions and ABC Signature Studios. It is unclear whether Marvel TV and ABC Studios will continue to pursue the project. The rights to the Deadpool character are owned by Fox, so until the pending Disney acquisition of Fox assets is completed, a Deadpool TV series will have to be done with another Fox production entity.

Deadpool has become one of Marvel's most popular characters since his debut in 1991, and the movie earned $783 million worldwide. Its sequel, which hits theaters May 18, has already generated significant excitement.

This news comes at a difficult time for Donald Glover, who has been very busy with his own projects. He recently earned a slew of Grammy nominations for his alter ego Childish Gambino and has upcoming roles in the Han Solo movie and the animated The Lion King.

We are deeply saddened to hear this news, and our thoughts are with Donald and Stephen Glover during this difficult time.

"Saw Thor: Ragnarok recently. While it's an okay movie, it doesn't quite reach greatness. The director, Taika Waititi, shows promise, but I believe the writers could have done better in their attempts to alter the series' tone and create a coherent narrative. The fanbase was overly hyped about the film, and while it was amusing, it wasn't as funny as Guardians of the Galaxy. The characters' behavior deviated from their established personalities, and the pacing felt rushed. The Sakaar sequences detracted from the movie's backstory on Asgard, and I wish more had been shown of Hela. Odin's scene was also somewhat absurd.

Valkyrie is fine, but I don't like the portrayal as a drunk. It's a cliche, and it doesn't accurately reflect the character. I love her chemistry with Bruce, and I hope their relationship continues in future installments. There doesn't seem to be any romantic tension between Valkyrie and Thor, which is fine.

Loki was the butt of jokes and seemed to lack his usual depth. He wasn't entirely in line with his previous characterization, and I question his relevance to the story. If Marvel doesn't give him a clear purpose beyond satisfying fans, his contract may not be renewed. I wouldn't be surprised if he's 'killed' off in Infinity War and then brought back to life in Avengers 4, perhaps as Kid Loki or Agent of Asgard Loki as Marvel introduces new Avengers members and seeks to reboot the franchise.

I enjoyed the dynamic between Bruce and Thor, and I don't like the forced inclusion of the Black Widow scene. I would prefer to see more scenes featuring Valkyrie and Bruce. The events of the movie left me feeling like I was watching a fan fiction or side story. While it may be entertaining, it doesn't align with the tone I would like to see in future sequels. Despite the positive reception from critics and fans, I'm in the minority on this opinion."

While times are slowly changing, Prince George will continue to follow this tradition, as will his younger brother Louis, who was born earlier this year. As they get older, they may follow in the footsteps of their older brothers, William and Harry, and wear suits during formal events and chinos with shirts for more informal settings.
