Rachel Weisz made a statement on the red carpet at the London premiere of The Mercy. The 47-year-old actress, who stars alongside Colin Firth in the drama, stunned in a high-necked blue floral dress with button detailing and a thigh-high slit in the skirt. She paired the dress with black sandals and simple make-up, making for an effortlessly chic appearance. The floral dress featured a daring side-split, adding to the boldness of Weisz's look. Weisz and Firth play the roles of Clare Crowhurst and Donald Crowhurst in the film, which documents the true story of the Sunday Times Golden Globe Race in 1968. Weisz and Firth have been friends since their 20s and got married in a private ceremony in 2011. The film hits cinemas on February 9th.

Blake Shelton has credited Gwen Stefani for helping him recover from his divorce from Miranda Lambert. The country singer discussed their romance in a new interview with Billboard magazine.

Shelton revealed that he was ending his marriage to Lambert during a meeting with their Voice coworkers. The new member of the team, Stefani, became emotional upon hearing the news. Shelton noticed her distress and commented, "Wow, she feels super bad for me!"

Stefani was also dealing with her own breakup with Gavin Rossdale at the time. They announced their separation in August 2015, just a month after Shelton and Lambert announced their divorce. During this difficult period, Shelton and Stefani leaned on each other for support.

As their friendship developed, Shelton began to see Stefani in a new light. He eventually confessed his feelings to her and they began dating. Their collaboration on the track "Go Ahead and Break My Heart" was included on Shelton's 12th studio album, If I'm Honest.

Shelton stated, "Gwen saved my life. Who else on earth could understand going through a high-profile divorce from another musician? You can‚Äôt even imagine the similarities in our divorces."

Maksim Chmerkovskiy and Vanessa Lachey were the focus of attention on Dancing with the Stars earlier this season after reports suggested they were not getting along. However, during their Snow White-themed routine on Disney Night Monday, the pair appeared to be a loving duo behind the scenes.

Before their performance, Lachey and Chmerkovskiy spent time chatting with Lachey's children in the front row. Chmerkovskiy then joked his way past Lachey, making her giggle. When the show resumed after the commercial break, the pair appeared uncomfortable, leading some fans to comment on their demeanor.

Despite reports of tension in the rehearsal room, Lachey relied on Chmerkovskiy for comfort during Monday's elimination. When it was announced that her husband, Nick Lachey, was not in jeopardy of elimination for the first time in three weeks, she threw herself into Chmerkovskiy's arms. He held her until the entire cast moved to say goodbye to Gleb Savchenko and Sasha Pieterse.

Chmerkovskiy and Lachey will return to the ballroom on Monday for Movie Night on Dancing with the Stars.

In the latest episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians, tensions between family members Kourtney, Kim, Khloe, Kris, and Caitlyn Jenner rose as they discussed the guest list for their annual Christmas Eve party. Kourtney initially objected to inviting her then-boyfriend Scott Disick due to his past behavior, but Kris argued that he was still part of the family. Kendall later joined the discussion and refused to invite Caitlyn Jenner, citing their past controversies. Despite their differing opinions, Kris made the final decision, leaving Kourtney as the only one supporting Caitlyn's invitation. The episode also featured Khloe's anticipation of her upcoming pregnancy announcement and her desire to keep the news private.

Selena Gomez, 25, and Justin Bieber, 23, are currently apart due to Gomez's trip to London for the Fashion Awards 2017. This is the furthest they have been apart since getting back together in October. While they have Facetime, Gomez misses Bieber dearly and is reflecting on the importance of their relationship.

"Gomez has been a bit bummed since her time out of the states and away from Bieber. She misses him dearly and the time apart has helped her realize how important he is to her," a source close to Gomez told HollywoodLife.com exclusively. "Selena felt the need to pull back a little but that has only made things more clear in her mind. Selena has a strong love and bond for Justin. She wanted alone time, got it, and it was what she needed. It has helped her learn about herself and how much Justin means to her. She genuinely misses him and is can't wait to get back to him," the insider added.

Gomez, who recently got back together with Bieber after a health scare, is cherishing their relationship and reflecting on what she wants now that she has a new lease on life. "I'm 25. I'm not 18, or 19, or 20," Gomez told Billboard magazine, in which she was named Woman of the Year. "I cherish people who have really impacted my life."

Gomez and Bieber have both grown a lot in their years apart and hope that their romance will go the distance this time around. HollywoodLifers, are you glad that Justin and Selena are back together? Or do you think he'll break her heart again?

The heart of Jeremy London was shattered in a moment of uncontrollable rage, leaving him facing a charge of domestic violence. The Mallrats actor, and twin brother of Jason London, was arrested on Friday in Jackson County, Mississippi on one count of domestic violence simple assault, a misdemeanor.

In the mug shot released by law enforcement, Jeremy London appears defeated, his once radiant features twisted in anger and sorrow. The details of the alleged incident are still murky, but sources close to the situation tell TMZ that it was an isolated incident, a desperate attempt to diffuse an emotionally-charged situation.

Jeremy and his wife, Juliet, are addressing the incident privately, seeking to heal the wounds that were inflicted. For those who know Jeremy, this is a man who is known for his charm and good nature, a man who has always been a source of light in the lives of those around him.

But even the strongest of us can be pushed to the brink, and Jeremy London's story is a reminder that we all have a breaking point. Let us all take a moment to consider the impact that our words and actions can have on those we love, and to always strive to act with compassion and kindness in all that we do.

Will Arnett and Erin David are dating, according to Us Weekly. Arnett, 43, and David, a Hollywood producer, have been seeing each other for some time. Arnett and David first worked together on the actor's now-canceled NBC series Up All Night, where David served as executive producer. Arnett and David have been spotted together at various events and parties, including Jen Aniston and Justin Theroux's holiday party. Arnett was previously married to Amy Poehler, with whom he has two sons.

Jamie Foxx and Katie Holmes have been rumored to be in a romantic relationship for some time now, but until now, there have been no public displays of affection. Recently, they were spotted at the beach, where they engaged in physical activity and shared a bottle of champagne. According to an onlooker, they seemed happy and in love.

Sources close to Holmes have commented on the nature of their relationship. One source has described it as a low-key, discreet affair, with the couple trying to avoid attention. Another source has spoken about Holmes' friend's reservations about her choice of romantic partner, with some expressing concern over his past history of not being able to commit.

Despite these reservations, it should be noted that the couple's relationship has been ongoing for five years, and the secretive nature of their relationship was due to a clause in Holmes' divorce agreement with Tom Cruise. In exchange for keeping her next relationship under wraps for five years, she received $11.4 million.

The "Disso Queen" of Hollywood, Laura Wasser, has handled countless divorce cases in her career as a divorce lawyer, but her own divorce in 1993 was the first and last. At just 25 years old, she swore she would never go through the pain of a divorce again. However, she has since represented some of the biggest names in Hollywood, including Robyn Gibson, Kate Walsh, Britney Spears, and Angelina Jolie.

Wasser, who is now 42 years old, has two boys and is raising them as a single mom. Her father, Dennis Wasser, is also a well-known divorce lawyer who handles the family affairs of Hollywood's elite. Laura's parents moved the family to Beverly Hills when she was just six years old, but she insists she wasn't spoiled.

Despite her success, Wasser has never forgotten her humble beginnings. She worked hard to pay for her car and negotiate her allowance and curfew, and she jokes that these early experiences helped shape her into the lawyer she is today.

Wasser values discretion and keeps her clients' privacy, even when millions of dollars are at stake. She reminds them that money they pay her could be going towards their children, and advises them to take the time to heal before moving on.

As a second-generation celebrity lawyer, Wasser is well-respected in Hollywood and has been featured in Vogue. She is also a devoted fashionista who occasionally walks the red carpet. Her father predicted she would follow in his footsteps, and she is proud to be carrying on his legacy.

A source has claimed that Selena Gomez has threatened to end her relationship with her new boyfriend, The Weeknd, if he continues to text his ex-girlfriend, Bella Hadid. According to Life & Style, the singer became "so angry" after catching her beau messaging the Victoria's Secret model. The source claims that Gomez has threatened to end the relationship unless The Weeknd stops all contact with Hadid.

The source also claims that The Weeknd is a "very independent guy" and will not be "told what to do" by Gomez. The insider claims that Gomez's "neediness" is a major turnoff for The Weeknd. The source further adds that people close to Hadid would not be surprised if she were to get back together with The Weeknd in the future.

It is unclear if the couple is in fact involved in a feud or if this report is true. However, recent rumors have suggested that the couple is in the "honeymoon phase" of their relationship. Fans have speculated that The Weeknd may propose soon, but a source has reportedly said that this is not going to happen anytime soon.

15 of 15 1983 Nicole Kidman, a young and vibrant woman with big curls, posed for a photo call for her first-ever movie, BMX Bandits, in her hometown of Sydney. She had just made her debut in the Australian film Bush Christmas that same year. Kidman's career in Australia would continue for a few more years, as she worked in both movies and TV.

But it was her international breakout role in 1989's Dead Calm that would change the course of her life. She portrayed the wife of a naval officer in the thrilling Australian thriller, and it was this movie that caught the attention of audiences worldwide and launched her into American cinema.

Her arrival to the American movie industry was in the film Days of Thunder in 1990, where she met Tom Cruise, who would become her husband. They tied the knot on December 24, 1990, in Telluride, Colorado. They appeared together at the Academy Awards in 1991, where Kidman earned her first-ever Golden Globe nomination for her role in the film Billy Bathgate.

However, their marriage was not meant to last. In February 2001, the couple announced their separation, and quickly after, they filed for divorce. It was a tough year for Kidman, but it was also a professional highlight, as her performance in the film Moulin Rouge earned her her first Oscar nomination and Golden Globe award, for best actress in a motion picture - musical or comedy.

After her divorce from Cruise, Kidman found love again with the musician Lenny Kravitz, but their relationship was brief and intense. They were even engaged, but Kidman revealed in 2017 that they had called things off in 2004. Kidman spoke about a secret fianc√© to Vanity Fair in 2007, saying "It just wasn't right. I wasn't ready. We weren't ready."

Things are all good between Kidman and Kravitz now. She told NET-A-PORTER.com's magazine, The EDIT, "I love Lenny; he's a great guy." In 2006, Kidman married her current husband, Keith Urban, in Sydney, Australia. They have two daughters together, Sunday Rose and Faith Margaret. Kidman continued her career success, earning Oscar and Golden Globe nominations for her film Rabbit Hole in 2011, and a Golden Globe nod for her film The Paperboy in 2013. And her show Big Little Lies with Reese Witherspoon, Laura Dern, Shailene Woodley, and Zoe Kravitz, the daughter of her ex-fianc√© Lenny Kravitz, earned her critical acclaim and numerous nominations. The past decade has been a big one for Kidman, and she is still as strong as ever with Urban by her side.

Jason Momoa, the 38-year-old American actor, has been on a promotional tour for his upcoming films. He recently appeared on the cover of Men's Health and American Airlines' in-flight magazine American Way. Momoa, who plays the lead role in the $300 million fantasy film Aquaman, is known for his role as Khal Drogo in Game of Thrones. He is currently filming the movie on Australia's east coast and is getting used to the attention that comes with his newfound fame. However, he is not comfortable with the attention and wishes to be remembered for his acting skills rather than his appearance.

According to sources exclusively reported by OK! magazine, John Mayer has taken a new approach to win back Katy Perry, despite her recent breakup with Orlando Bloom. The musician was said to have sent Katy 100 roses and a card with a message reading, "I'm here for you" after the breakup. However, sources claim that Katy was not receptive to John's attempt and rejected his bouquet. Instead, she instructed an assistant to donate the flowers to a nursing home and shared a photograph of the elderly residents with the tokens of love on social media.

Julianne Hough, a judge on the popular dancing competition show "Dancing with the Stars," and Brooks Laich, a professional ice hockey player, were married in an outdoor ceremony in Idaho on July 8. The wedding, which took place on Lake Coeur d'Alene, was attended by more than 200 guests and was described by Hough's brother Derek as "a timeless, magical, romantic experience that was truly perfect in every way." The ceremony was held in the fields of Coeur d'Alene, and the newlyweds spent the night dancing under the stars at a reception held on the same lake where they spent summer vacations growing up.

Selena Gomez, 25, has recently shifted her focus to herself and away from distractions. She revealed on June 29th that she no longer resides in Los Angeles and is no longer concerned with public opinion. However, despite her efforts to distance herself from the city and its associated stressors, Selena Gomez cannot seem to shake her thoughts of Justin Bieber, her ex-boyfriend.

A source close to Selena Gomez exclusively told HollywoodLife that Selena has fond memories from her past relationship with Justin Bieber. She brought Justin and his siblings to previous Hotel Transylvania premieres and has many positive emotions associated with those experiences.

Despite Selena's efforts to move on from Justin, her friends and family know that she still has feelings for him. However, they do not want to see them together again. Justin Bieber is currently in a relationship with Hailey Baldwin.

Selena Gomez's decision to focus on herself and move away from Los Angeles is a positive step towards a healthier outlook on life. However, moving on from past relationships is not always easy, and Selena Gomez is currently going through a difficult time. We wish her the best during this time.

It has been reported that George Clooney is being investigated by the FBI for alleged money laundering. National Enquirer claims that the actor "has been dragged into an FBI probe, after gifting stunned dinner party guests with $1 MILLION in cash stuffed in a designer bag!" However, Gossip Cop has debunked these allegations, stating that there is no real probe or scandal involving Clooney, and he has not attracted any "federal attention." A representative for the "Ocean's Eleven" star has confirmed that the story made by National Enquirer is fabricated.

"The Handmaid's Tale" Continues to Bind Viewers in Dystopian World: Hulu Renews Hit Series for Third Season!

Just one week after the Emmy-winning, dystopian drama's second season premiered, Hulu has announced that it will continue to force viewers into the oppressive world of The Handmaid's Tale for another season! And there was no doubt that it would happen.

The Elisabeth Moss-fronted series has officially been renewed for a third season, confirming that the grip of the oppressive regime is only tightening. And with last week's Season 2 premiere earning double the viewership of the Season 1 opener, it's clear that audiences are hooked on this terrifying and thought-provoking world.

But Hulu's announcement doesn't stop there. The streaming giant has also confirmed that it has officially picked up Four Weddings and a Funeral, a series adaptation of the 1994 romantic comedy exec produced by Mindy Kaling and Matt Warburton.

As previously reported, the project follows a group of friends as their lives intersect through five events. Each season would feature a brand new cast, providing a fresh perspective on the relationships and drama that audiences have come to love.

So buckle up, because The Handmaid's Tale and Four Weddings and a Funeral are just getting started. Get ready to be trapped in a world of dystopian horrors and heart-wrenching romance.

"A groundbreaking moment in Grammy history was made on Sunday night as Alessia Cara became the only woman to present a solo Grammy during the awards telecast, taking home the prestigious Best New Artist award. However, the Recording Academy president Neil Portnow's comments on the #GrammysSoMale controversy left many feeling unimpressed.

Portnow boldly declared that "women who have the creativity in their hearts and souls, who want to be musicians, engineers, producers, and executives in the industry, need to step up." He added, "I don't have personal experience of those kinds of brick walls that you face but I think it's upon us ‚Äî us as an industry ‚Äî to make the welcome mat very obvious, breeding opportunities for all people who want to be creative and create that next generation of artists."

Despite Portnow's words, the Grammys producer Ken Ehrlich refused to address the issue, simply stating, "It's not for me to talk about. I produce the TV show." When asked about the lack of an onstage moment for Album of the Year nominee Lorde, Ehrlich gave a vague answer, "I don't know if it was a mistake. These shows are a matter of choices. We have a box and it gets full."

However, the pre-telecast ceremony did see several female winners, including Lisa Loeb, Reba McEntire, Aimee Mann, and Carrie Fisher. Rihanna even shared a win with Kendrick Lamar for Best Rap/Sung Performance for the song "Loyalty." Chris Stapleton, who won Best Country Album, was more diplomatic, stating that "equality is something we have to address on a lot of levels."

One thing is for sure, the attendance of Taylor Swift will be crucial in determining if she will be present at next year's ceremony."

Ethan Hawke recently revealed that he and his former costar Angelina Jolie still keep in touch through holiday cards. The actor, who worked with Jolie on the film "Taking Lives" over ten years ago, spoke to USA Today about the actress and her life at the time. He described Jolie as "punk rock" and "awesome" for her unique style and for her humanitarian work. The actor also praised Jolie for transcending the objectification she faced in the media and making serious films.

On Wednesday, reality television stars Kim Kardashian West and Dinesh D‚ÄôSouza met with President Donald Trump in the Oval Office to discuss prison reform and Kardashian's request for a presidential pardon for Alice Marie Johnson, a grandmother who was sentenced to life in prison without parole for a drug crime. Johnson, who was interviewed by Mic, explained that she needed the money to support her family and that she had been through a difficult period in her life. Kardashian was moved by the interview and expressed her support for Johnson on social media.

After the meeting, Trump released a photograph of himself and Kardashian in the Oval Office, which was met with media scrutiny and criticism. The New York Post, for example, featured a joke about Kardashian's rear end on its Thursday cover, and the image was retweeted and liked thousands of times.

The response to Kardashian's request for a presidential pardon highlights the differences in how male and female leaders are perceived in society. Trump, as a male reality television star, is perceived as an alpha male who never backs down and is not afraid to accept criticism. Kardashian, as a female reality television star, is perceived as a glamorous and ageless icon who is often treated as a joke, despite her significant influence and ability to draw attention to important causes.

While celebrities often use their platform to draw attention to important issues, Kardashian's involvement in prison reform was met with skepticism and criticism from some experts in the field. Kristen Clarke, the president of the Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights Under Law, expressed her concerns that Kardashian did not bring the necessary expertise and experience to tackle the complex issue of prison reform on a national scale.

Overall, the response to Kardashian's request for a presidential pardon highlights the double standards that exist in society when it comes to male and female leaders and the importance of considering the qualifications and experience of those who take up important causes.

Robert Osborne, the host of Turner Classic Movies since its launch in 1994, has passed away at the age of 84. He had been suffering from undisclosed health problems. Osborne was an indispensable guide to viewers who tuned in everyday to hear his thoughts on Hollywood and film. He was an expert on the history of the Oscars and authored several books on the subject, including "Academy Awards Illustrated" and "The Official History of the Academy Awards."

Longtime friend Liza Minnelli paid tribute to Osborne, stating that his knowledge of Hollywood and film was second to none. TCM shared a touching video with Osborne's friends and colleagues, which included industry figures such as Cher, Patton Oswalt, Patricia Arquette, Gilbert Gottfried, and others expressing their grief on social media.

The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences also paid tribute to Osborne, stating that he worked tirelessly to document the organization's rich history and was a beloved friend. Osborne was a remarkable and special man who brought joy to people around the world by sharing his knowledge and love of film.

Our thoughts are with all who love and mourn the passing of Robert Osborne.

Kanye West has shared a personal holiday photograph featuring himself, wife Kim Kardashian, and their children North and Saint. The image, which West posted on Twitter with the message "Happy Holidays," appears more subdued than one might expect from a typical holiday greeting.

While it is unclear when and where the photograph was taken, it is believed to have been taken during Kris Jenner's annual Christmas Eve party, which both Kanye and Kim attended. A source told Us magazine that most of the Kardashian-Jenner family was present at the event, including Khloe, Kourtney, Kendall, Kylie, and Caitlyn Jenner, as well as John Legend, Babyface, and David Foster, who provided music.

Kim and Kanye have been relatively low-key in recent months, following Kim's high-profile robbery in Paris in October and Kanye's reported hospitalization in November. Despite these challenges, the family appears to have remained united as they prepare to bid farewell to 2016 and welcome in the new year.

In a recent appearance on Watch What Happens Live, John Legend offered an update on the couple's well-being.

Chris Pratt and Anna Faris have announced their separation from each other, and some fans have taken to social media to blame actress Jennifer Lawrence for the split. No evidence has been presented suggesting that Lawrence had any involvement in the breakup, and she has not responded to the allegations. Some fans have referenced an awkward embrace between Faris and Lawrence at the premiere of the film Passengers in 2016, in which Faris appeared to have a pained expression while Lawrence kept her hands claw-like.

The Fifty Shades Darker press tour is set to begin, but fans may be disappointed as the lead actors, Jamie Dornan and Dakota Johnson, have reportedly refused to promote the film. According to gossip websites, Johnson and Dornan have declined opportunities to discuss the movie, causing some fans to question their casting as Anastasia Steele and Christian Grey.

However, Gossip Cop has denied these claims, stating that Dornan and Johnson are actually preparing to promote the film, which is set for a Valentine's Day release. However, Gossip Cop debunked this report as well, stating that the film has been completed and there are no plans to reshoot the sex scenes.

Kim Kardashian recently announced that she and Kanye West are expecting their third child. Multiple sources have reported that Khloe Kardashian is expecting her first child with boyfriend Tristan Thompson, and there have been recent reports that Kylie Jenner is pregnant with her first child with boyfriend Travis Scott. However, their mother Kris Jenner has stated that Kylie is not confirming anything. It has been speculated that Kim may have revealed the pregnancy news weeks ago in an Instagram post.

Mariah Carey and Nick Cannon reportedly had an argument at the Kids' Choice Awards while sitting in their seats. A source told OK! exclusively that the couple, who put on a united front on the red carpet, had an argument while they were inside. The source did not specify what the argument was about, but it did not appear to be resolved as Mariah left her seat and Nick took their children to her manager's children. It is not clear why Nick took the children away from the show.

According to sources close to Selena Gomez, the actress has expressed a specific desire to kiss her boyfriend Justin Bieber as the clock strikes midnight on New Year's Eve. The sources claim that Gomez is eager to spend the upcoming holiday season with Bieber, following a challenging year that included family drama. The actress is reportedly eager to be with Bieber as the new year begins and wants to feel his arms around her and receive a kiss from him. While Gomez's decision to reunite with Bieber has been met with mixed reactions, her mother, Mandy Teefey, has reportedly expressed her heartbreak over the couple's reunion.

A comparison of the handwriting of Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle has revealed significant differences in their personalities, according to handwriting expert Jamie Mason Cohen. Cohen analyzed samples of their writing and stated that Kate's writing demonstrates her ability to control her emotions, specifically her temper, and that she is restrained and proud of it. On the other hand, Cohen believes that Meghan's writing suggests that she is more emotional and that she enjoys being the center of attention. He also noted that Meghan and Prince Harry may be facing personality clashes as their writing indicates opposing personalities.

The Vampire Diaries alum, Steven R. McQueen, has ended his engagement to Alexandra Silva, leaving his fans heartbroken and confused.

The 29-year-old actor revealed the news at the Voices in Displacement Gala hosted by the Syrian American Medical Society on Friday. When asked about the status of their wedding planning, he simply said, "You know what? Actually, we called it off."

McQueen, named after his grandfather, Steve McQueen, had announced the engagement news to Silva on Instagram in January, sharing a photo of the two holding hands and sharing a kiss, giving fans a glimpse of her new engagement ring. Silva reposted the photo on her own Instagram account, captioning it, "My best friend, love of my life‚Ä¶YES, yes yes a million times over."

However, the last photo of McQueen on Silva's account dates back to January 1, and both posts have since been deleted. It's unclear what caused the split or whether the couple plans to remain friends.

Before getting engaged, the couple had been dating for over a year. McQueen is best known for playing Jeremy Gilbert on The Vampire Diaries from 2009-15, and he has also starred in Chicago Fire and Chicago P.D.

While many fans are heartbroken by the news, we hope that both McQueen and Silva find happiness in the future.

Gwen Stefani has addressed rumors that she has been dumped by Blake Shelton, posting a picture of the couple kissing on Instagram. The image serves as a clear message that their relationship is still on, despite recent claims that Shelton was tired of Stefani's "needy" behavior and drama involving her ex-husband, Gavin Rossdale. The biggest fashion faux pas for a wedding guest would be to upstage the bride. With all the attention and speculation surrounding Kate Middleton's gown for her upcoming royal wedding, it would be nearly impossible to do. However, there are other unwritten rules that guests should consider. Don't wear white, anything too revealing, or a hat that is too wide or tall to block the view of the person behind you. You can wear tasteful black, and be sure to cover your arms.

"This is not a place to make a fashion statement for yourself," said Sally Kilbridge, deputy editor of Brides magazine. She goes on to list more don'ts, including no miniskirts, plunging necklines, and novelty socks, which have become a surprising trend among guests at American weddings. The attire worn to a British royal wedding is appropriate daytime wedding attire kicked up many notches, Kilbridge said. Everyone's outfit should be chic, elegant, and suit the very formal, traditional occasion while not letting glitzy, black-tie, eveningwear trappings creep in.

Designer Reem Acra thinks Westminster Abbey could be the place for cocktail frocks, especially for celebrities and fashion editors who have long found reason to wear them before noon. The fashion role model for older women should be well-cut, luxe-fabric skirt suits, while Middleton's younger friends could pull off slightly retro, Hitchcock-inspired sheaths or pencil skirts paired with nipped-waist jackets. George Kotsiopoulos, co-host of E!'s Fashion Police, expects a lot of hats, but hopes they'll be toned-down cloches or a pillbox with a veil.

Vivien Sheriff, a British milliner who has made several dozen custom headpieces for wedding guests, said many guests will follow the lead of Middleton's mother, Carole, who is a fan of substantial hats. The hats Sheriff has made feature some feathers and crystals, but they're not oversized. "You can't show off too much. You don't want to overdo it, but there is a lot of expression in the headpieces." Sheriff added that people aren't going to want to hide their faces, so the brims won't cover them. "This way, everyone can get good photos and you can greet other guests looking them in the eye."

There will be more black than one might expect, Sheriff said. She had more orders for black than she expected. "I guess fashion has changed and a lot of young guests want to wear black." However, black is fine as long as it's not funereal, according to Brides' Kilbridge, although the Middleton family won't wear it. Prince Charles' wife, Camilla, won't wear it either, Kilbridge predicted. Camilla will likely pluck something she already had in her closet, Kilbridge said, probably something not unlike the tailored dress and lovely coat she wore to her own wedding.

Most of the male guests will likely don a navy or gray morning suit, which is basically the daytime equivalent of a tuxedo including a vest or waistcoat. All of William's military friends will be in uniform, Kilbridge said. A guest with a well-known personal style has a little more flexibility, said Kilbridge. It would be perfectly acceptable for Elton John, for example, to wear a flashy, embroidered vest under his jacket. Fashion fans will be eager to see David and Victoria Beckham, and Kilbridge thinks they won't disappoint, although she wonders how Victoria Beckham will dress her baby bump. "They've had some crazy fashion moments, but this won't be one of them. She'll probably look fantastic. They want to create the impression that she belongs there. I think most people will be striving to look like they belong." That might have singer Joss Stone, who is famously barefoot almost everywhere she goes, digging to the bottom of her closet looking for a pair of shoes.

My wife n I were at a Hollywood function last year n a high level Hollywood executive came over 2 me and groped my privates."

The Hollywood Reporter confirmed that WME exec Adam Venit was placed on leave late last week to allow the talent firm to investigate Crews' allegation. Crews and the LAPD declined to comment.

As Crews steps forward with his truth, the weight of his experience bears down on him. The bravery it takes to speak out against sexual assault is nothing short of heroic, and Crews' decision to share his story is a powerful act of courage.

The incident has left Crews with PTSD, a condition that can be triggered by even the slightest reminder of the traumatic event. His bravery in sharing his story serves as a reminder that survivors of sexual assault deserve to be heard and believed.

As the investigation continues, Crews stands in solidarity with all survivors of sexual assault. He knows the pain that comes with speaking out, and he is a shining example of strength and resilience in the face of unimaginable trauma.

"Breaking the Record: Selena Gomez Named Billboard's 2017 Woman of the Year!"

The music world is abuzz with the announcement that Selena Gomez has been named Billboard's 2017 Woman of the Year. The award-winning singer, producer, and actress will be presented with the prestigious honor at the annual Women in Music dinner and awards gala on Nov. 30 in Los Angeles.

Gomez joins an illustrious list of previous honorees, including Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, Pink, Katy Perry, Fergie, Beyonc√©, and last year's winner, Madonna, who made headlines with her powerful speech on feminism and sexism.

"Selena Gomez is not only soaring to the top of the charts with her latest hits, but she is also inspiring young women everywhere to be authentic, give back, and not be afraid to use their voice," said John Amato, president of The Hollywood Reporter-Billboard Media Group. "She is fearless in speaking her mind and has used her platform to advocate for the needs of others. We are thrilled to be able to honor her as our Woman of the Year."

Gomez's career has never been better, with hits such as "Same Old Love," "Hands to Myself," and "We Don't Talk Anymore" dominating the Billboard Hot 100. Her albums have also been a major force, with Revival and Stars Dance leading the charts in 2015 and 2013 respectively.

In addition to her music career, Gomez has also made a name for herself in the world of philanthropy, raising over $500,000 for the Lupus Research Alliance and serving as an active ambassador for UNICEF since 2009.

This year's Women in Music event will also recognize the most powerful female executives in the industry, with additional honorees to be announced in due course. And for the first time, the event and a red-carpet pre-show will be broadcast live on Twitter from 9pm-midnight EST on Nov. 30. Sponsors of the 2017 edition include Twitter, American Airlines, Iron Mountain Entertainment Services, and Nielsen Music.

This is a huge moment for Selena Gomez, and one that is sure to inspire millions of young women around the world. She is a true icon, and we can't wait to see what she does next.

Angelina Jolie has faced numerous negative headlines in recent times, following her divorce and custody battle with Brad Pitt. In her piece, Jolie shared moving accounts of what education means to children whose lives and communities have been upended by the ongoing Syrian civil war. She met these girls during her goodwill trips to refugee camps in the war-torn region. She described one girl who had given up her dream of going to school and becoming a doctor after her mother was killed in an airstrike and she was forced to take care of her five younger siblings. With no other choice, the girl married at 14, can't read or write, and has been "robbed of her childhood and the future she might have had."

Jolie argues that wealthier countries can help less fortunate countries rebuild after war by providing resources such as school report cards, exams passed, qualifications obtained, jobs acquired, and young lives turned to good purpose rather than spent languishing in camps. She concludes that helping refugees in a "patient, long-term manner, guided by our values" is the wise and morally right course of action.

She will also be seen in a sequel to The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel and a much-delayed adaptation of Deborah Moggach's novel Tulip Fever.

The Harvey Weinstein scandal has taken another devastating turn as the embattled producer was expelled from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences board on Saturday. On Saturday evening, a group of 82 women, including Cate Blanchett, Kristen Stewart, Jane Fonda, and Ava DuVernay, held a silent protest on the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival. The women stood together in solidarity, calling for greater representation and equal opportunities in the film industry.

In a joint statement, Blanchett and French director Agnes Varda emphasized the need for transparency and parity in executive bodies and work environments. They called for governments to enforce equal pay laws and for workplaces to be diverse and equitable. The women also acknowledged the efforts of those standing for change and called for the industry's stairways to be accessible to all.

The protest was part of the 5050x2020 movement, which seeks to achieve gender parity across all aspects of the film industry by the year 2020. The number 82 was selected to match the number of films directed by women in the festival's history, with only 4.3% of competition films in the past 71 years being directed by women.

Other notable women involved in the protest included Salma Hayek, Marion Cotillard, director Patty Jenkins, and Haifaa al-Mansour. The protest was organized by French group Le Deuxieme Regard and the 5050x2020 collective, in collaboration with the Cannes Film Festival.

The protest comes in the wake of the Harvey Weinstein scandal and the #MeToo and Time's Up movements, which have sparked a renewed demand for change in the film industry. The movement also echoes broader calls for gender equality and diversity in the workplace.

While progress has been made in recent years, with more women making the cut in competition, the statistics for women in Cannes are still dismal. Only one woman has won the Palme d'Or, and only one woman has been named Best Director. The festival has been criticized for its lack of diversity and inclusion, and for failing to provide a platform for women filmmakers.

However, the rise of women in the film industry is undeniable, and the protest at Cannes highlights the need for continued efforts to promote gender equality and diversity in the industry. As the movement continues to gain momentum, it remains to be seen what concrete actions will be taken to address these issues and create a more inclusive and equitable film industry.

Colton Haynes, a beloved actor and advocate for the LGBTQ+ community, has shared a heart-wrenching message about Hollywood's treatment of LGBT actors. In a series of tweets on August 29, Haynes criticized the industry for placing too much emphasis on actors' personal lives and not enough on their talent.

"Hollywood is so f**ked up," he wrote. "So much of the focus is on your personal life & has nothing to do with the talent you have to bring to the table."

He then praised American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy, Arrow executive producer Greg Berlanti, and Teen Wolf creator Jeff Davis for giving him opportunities and recognizing that being gay is more than just a part of his personal life. "Thank god for Ryan Murphy, Greg Berlanti, & Jeff Davis," Haynes tweeted. "They believe gay actors are more than just their personal lives."

Haynes, who came out as gay in 2016 and is engaged to celebrity floral designer Jeff Leatham, has previously spoken about the struggles he faced in Hollywood due to his sexuality. He revealed that people in the industry had advised him to hide his relationship, and that he was even set up with girls for press.

However, Haynes is no longer alone in his fight for LGBTQ+ representation in Hollywood. He is grateful for the showrunners who embrace people's personal lives and their truth, and he is excited to see the change that is happening in the industry.

"So disappointed in how Hollywood can't understand that playing a character has nothing to do with how u live your personal life," Haynes wrote. "But not anymore. You have all these amazing showrunners who actually embrace people's personal lives and embrace people's truth."

Haynes' message is a powerful reminder that everyone, regardless of their sexual orientation or gender identity, deserves to be treated with respect and recognized for their talent. It is a message that we all need to hear, and it is one that we should all strive to live by.

Jennifer Lawrence recently made an unusual statement while discussing her new film, Joy, with the director David O. Russell. She said, "David respects me so much that he will literally forget what sex I am," adding, "He sometimes refers to me as a 'he' without realizing it." This comment raises questions about gender identity and the dynamics between directors and actors in their working relationships.

This dynamic can lead to interesting collaborations, as some actors are recognized as muses who inspire the male directors who create scenarios around them and explore their faces with the camera. Many muses have become partners or wives, such as Ingrid Bergman with Roberto Rossellini and Anna Karina with Jean-Luc Godard. However, the muse model is not always a straightforward relationship, as the French director Leos Carax admitted in an interview about the film Les Amants du Pont-Neuf, where his then lover Juliette Binoche starred. Carax dreamed of someday directing a film and having a beautiful girlfriend, and he admits that he did not know Binoche well.

Despite the challenges in the artist-muse relationship, it can also be a source of strength, as Nina Hoss, who has worked with the German director Christian Petzold on six films, believes. Hoss thinks that difference is a source of strength and that Petzold chooses women for his characters because it gives him some distance, making the relationship interesting and surprising.

Overall, the relationship between directors and actors can be complex and ever-evolving, and it is important to understand the dynamics at play in order to appreciate the work that these creative professionals produce.

It has been reported that Brad Pitt does not have a rare condition known as prosopagnosia, also known as face blindness. Prosopagnosia is a neurological disorder that affects an individual's ability to recognize familiar faces. People with prosopagnosia may have difficulty distinguishing between different faces, even those of close friends and family members.

Additionally, it has been revealed that Brad Pitt is an honorary member of the Epidermolysis Bullosa Medical Research Foundation (EBMRF), a foundation dedicated to raising awareness and funds for the rare skin disorder, epidermolysis bullosa. This condition is also known as "the worst disease you've never heard of" and is characterized by blisters and erosions on the skin.

It is important to note that being diagnosed with a condition by a medical professional and being self-diagnosed can be two very different things. While Brad Pitt has been self-diagnosed with prosopagnosia, it should be noted that a proper diagnosis by a medical professional is necessary for accurate information and treatment.

Judd Apatow has expressed his disappointment towards Quentin Tarantino for not taking a stronger stance against Harvey Weinstein's alleged mistreatment of women. Apatow wrote on Twitter, "Knew enough since Clinton was President and MC Hammer was selling millions of records. That‚Äôs a lot of years to not confront a friend," on Thursday night.

In an interview with the New York Times on Thursday, Tarantino acknowledged that he was aware of Weinstein's alleged mistreatment of women for several years but did not take adequate action to stop it. Tarantino, who had collaborated extensively with Weinstein on various film projects, admitted that he knew about Weinstein's actions as early as the '90s but did not do enough to address the situation.

Tarantino acknowledged that he had heard firsthand from his ex-girlfriend Mira Sirvino and another unnamed actress about their experiences with Weinstein. He was also aware that Rose McGowan, who had previously tweeted about Weinstein raping her, had reached a legal settlement with him. "I knew enough to do more than I did," Tarantino told the paper. "Anything I say now will sound like a crappy excuse."

Tarantino continued to collaborate with Weinstein in the years following the incidents, including on Oscar-nominated films "Inglourious Basterds" and "Django Unchained." A representative for Apatow declined to comment, while Tarantino did not respond to the request for a statement.
